column1:
0,"

“There is the notion that an attractive woman, whatever that means in society, a pretty girl can’t be smart. We are still identified by our looks instead of our hearts or heads. That’s why it’s much better to break the rules.” – Gloria Steinem

I couldn’t agree more.

I have always loved glamorous things: clothes, shoes, hats, purses, sunglasses, etc. As far back as I can remember, while I roamed around department stores with my mother – trying on as many extravagant hats as I could get my hands on – she was describing people to me by what they wore (instead of their names) so I could recall them.  Also as far back as I can remember, I’ve been an academically driven person – someone who has described herself as a nerd on numerous occasions. I never thought these two worlds would have a difficult time coexisting. However, as I grew older I noticed the people surrounding me were uncomfortable putting these two categories in the same box – or the same person for that matter. You could be artistic or academic, not both. You could be pretty or smart, not both. You could be fashionable or taken seriously, not both. Something had to give.

With all of the negative stigmas attached to fashion, style, and taking care of your appearance – it’s really no wonder women as a whole have such skewed views of themselves. And because of those skewed views – it’s no surprise why we treat one another so poorly. We beat ourselves up – afraid that others are about to do it for us at any moment. “If I lost an inch here, gained an inch there, was taller, or shorter, thinner, or curvier, smarter, more stylish, funnier, quieter, louder..” Ladies of the world – you are who you are, so it’s time to start loving that woman. In the words of RuPaul – “If you can’t love yourself, how the hell are you gonna love somebody else?” And I feel – no, I know – that a lot of this can come from the way you present yourself to the world. (And there’s nothing negative about it.)

When I was in high school, a fellow female student wrote a monthly fashion column in our school newspaper. Every month, I’d read it – hoping to be entertained, educated, and/or excited. Instead, I was usually ashamed, angered, or simply disgusted. In each article, she would give mini tutorials on how to dress – however, rather than explaining how to dress for yourself – for your own self expression, self respect, or self confidence. She was teaching the girls in my high school to dress purely for the opposite sex. After a couple months of frustration, I wrote a letter to the editor and to my surprise, they published it. I explained (with all the eloquence of a 16 year old) that when I woke up each morning, I got dressed for myself. Whether that meant a mini skirt and heels or a t-shirt and jeans – I did it for me. Did I want boys to find me attractive? Of course – I was a heterosexual teenage girl. But even at that age, I knew that fashion meant more than that – it had so much more potential. Potential for positivity, respect, expression, whimsy, and creativity. This is why (soon after) I took over her fashion column. This is why (soon after that) I became co-editor of the newspaper. This why I enrolled in fashion classes. This is why I got a design degree from the Fashion Institute of Technology. This is why I design clothing. This is why I’m talking to you. This is why I started SmartGlamour.

I’ve always wanted to be involved in fashion – to make clothes for a living, but just getting people to buy some tops, skirts, and dresses from me is not enough. SmartGlamour isn’t just fashionable, affordable clothing – SmartGlamour is a way of life. It’s a revolution. It’s waking up everyday, taking pride in yourself – your appearance, your brains, and your heart – your inside and your outside. It’s putting your best foot forward – being kind, positive, and driven. It’s lifting other women up – instead of pushing them down. This will, in turn, lift you up as well.

Fashion as empowerment. Fashion as a revolution.

You can be intelligent, fashionable, smart, sexy, clever, stylish, driven, and successful. You can be anything you want to be. And it starts now.

With your funding I plan to:

-Buy fabric and materials for my first collection

-Invest money into launching e-commerce on my website

-Buy a new (and third) sewing machine that will help me more efficiently create top quality garments

-Give back to the volunteers (models, music, venue, refreshments, and organizers) who help me put my event together

 

If you are unable to help me reach my goal - please share and spread the SmartGlamour word to everyone you know! Help SmartGlamour become a worldwide movement!

Durable and flexible frames – Made from TR90 memory polymer, this unique material allows the frames to be bent without snapping or showing signs of stress, and always return to their original shape.
High protection lenses – Made from impact resistant polycarbonate, our lenses filter 100% of UVA and UVB rays and are polarised to reduce glare and enhance optical clarity.

Our lifetime guarantee to you – Our sunglasses use the best quality materials available and we stand behind them. That’s why we’re offering a lifetime guarantee on every pair of SunGods – if they break we will repair or replace them free of charge.
SunGods are completely customisable – Don’t be restricted by limited frame and lens options. Design the pair of sunglasses you’ve always wanted.

Over 2,500 combinations – Choose the arm and fronts from 8 different matte frame colours, and the lenses from 5 different polarised and mirrored colour options. *UPDATE: now 6,000 combinations with Stretch Goal 1 unlocked!*
Design your SunGods here  – Create and visualise your SunGods before you pledge. Can’t decide? Try the randomiser button... if you dare.

Durable and flexible – Made from TR90, a memory polymer known as “titanium plastic”, the frames are extremely flexible which reduces the risk of breakage. They are also BPA free and do not degrade with light or sweat.
Premium matte finish – Keeps your sunglasses in place even when wet and stays cool on your face without getting sticky or sweaty. We've added a brushed zinc metal logo for an enhanced finish.
Wear them all day – Despite it’s durability, TR90 is very lightweight which makes our frames really comfortable to wear, all day long.
100% UVA and UVB protection – Lenses that will protect your eyes from all harmful UV light. All our lenses exceed EN 1836 (CE) and ANSI Z80.3 (FDA) standards.
Polarised precision – Our polarised polycarbonate core reduces glare from horizontal surfaces like snow, water and the road, increasing depth perception and providing enhanced optical clarity.

Scratch and impact resistant – Used for aircraft windscreens and bulletproof glass, polycarbonate is known for it’s shatter-resistant properties and superior optical precision. We’ve also added a scratch-resistant film to keep your lenses protected and looking good.
SunGods are built to last – and we have faith in their longevity. If your SunGods break we will repair or replace them free of charge. Simple.

column4: >For the last 6 months we’ve been working with manufacturers, testing materials and finalising samples to develop SunGod Sunglasses to what you see today. We’ve created a product we’re really excited to share with you and we hope you’ll love.
>We now need your support to get SunGods into production!
>As a reward for your pledge, we're going to send you the first production run of SunGods.
>All pairs are customisable and come with a white SunGod microfibre cleaning and storage pouch. Shipping is included to all UK and US addresses, for rest of world please add £5.
>Any questions? Please drop us a line at hello@sungod.co
>Thanks for your support and for checking out SunGod Sunglasses!

column3: >Having reached £60,000, we're really excited to share our latest project development:

column1: 285 million people live with blindness or visual impairment, 90% of these in the world's poorest countries. Yet
column2: > 80% of all visual impairment can be prevented or cured through medication or surgery.

column1: For every pair of SunGods we sell, we'll help towards restoring vision or preventing blindness for one person in a developing country through our giving to Sightsavers, an international charity working with partners in Asia, Africa and the Caribbean.

column2: >Please help us give back by continuing to support and share our project!

column4: >When do I design my SunGods? We'll send you a link at the end of the campaign when you can submit your design to us from our sunglasses designer. While you wait, you can work on your design here.
>I forgot to add international shipping, what do I do? Don't worry, we'll be in touch at the end of the campaign to sort it out.

>What size are SunGods? Our sunglasses are one size fits all and comparable size to other similar styled sunglasses available. As we've used a super flexible TR90 plastic, our frames fit well on both large and small heads!

We now need your support to get SunGods into production!
THE PERKS (see top right of page!)
As a reward for your pledge, we're going to send you the first production run of SunGods.
All pairs are customisable and come with a white SunGod microfibre cleaning and storage pouch. Shipping is included to all UK and US addresses, for rest of world please add £5.
Any questions? Please drop us a line at hello@sungod.co
Thanks for your support and for checking out SunGod Sunglasses!
Having reached £60,000, we're really excited to share our latest project development:
285 million people live with blindness or visual impairment, 90% of these in the world's poorest countries. Yet 80% of all visual impairment can be prevented or cured through medication or surgery.

For every pair of SunGods we sell, we'll help towards restoring vision or preventing blindness for one person in a developing country through our giving to Sightsavers, an international charity working with partners in Asia, Africa and the Caribbean.
Please help us give back by continuing to support and share our project!
When do I design my SunGods? We'll send you a link at the end of the campaign when you can submit your design to us from our sunglasses designer. While you wait, you can work on your design here.
I forgot to add international shipping, what do I do? Don't worry, we'll be in touch at the end of the campaign to sort it out.

What size are SunGods? Our sunglasses are one size fits all and comparable size to other similar styled sunglasses available. As we've used a super flexible TR90 plastic, our frames fit well on both large and small heads!",17.0,0,"2 Campaigns
Off With Her Head Millinery by Lisa Jones
Off With Her Head Millinery is a business born out of a genuine love of hats.

My name is Lisa Jones. I am a self taught milliner and I create hats and fascinators from my home studio in Fife, Scotland I am influenced by original vintage designs, film and TV, as well as my love of vintage 40's and 50's style. This year I took the decision to apply to Nightwalk Events to showcase an 8 piece collection at their SS2013 Fashion Show on the 30th April. I was lucky enought to be one of the designers selected, so I will be showing my collection entitled 'Turning Japanese'. My campaign will allow me to complete this collection and bring my designs to a much wider audience. This is a huge step for me and my little business!

To create my collection I'm looking to raise £1000. This money will not only help me to purchase the materials I need to make my 8 piece collection. It will also help my to put together and style 8 complete outfits for my models and go towards publicity for the 'Turning Japanese' collection.

I'm offering some fantastic perks for your cotributions! Contributions to my campaign start at just £1. Everyone who gives just £5 or more will be entered into a prize draw to win a one-of-a-kind fascinator from Off With Her Head Millinery. From £10 upwards I have goodie bags up for grabs that will include hair clips, hair flowers, and signed limited edition prints of the complete collection depending on your contribution. I also have 2 pairs of tickets for the event in Glasgow on the 30th April for those who fancy being extremely generous!

And even if you can't contribute financially to my campaign you can help by getting the word around about my campaign and my little business! Share wiht your friends on Facebook, Twitter, mention me on you Blog! I'm extremely grateful for all your help and support!

Baseball, Brothers, Family

Montana(12) and Dalton(9) have grown up on baseball. Both playing since they were three years old, their dream has always been to be pro ball players...well that and a Super Hero(Dalton), and a Paleontologist(Montana). This year, in addition to rec ball and school ball, they both made a local travel team. With that honor comes a huge commitment of time and an even larger financial one. We support them 100% in their pursuit of baseball, but told them they would need to help raise half of the money for this season. That brings us here.

What They Need

The total costs just in fees for the boys this season will climb close to $6,000. They hope to raise half of that amount.

$230 - Rec Ball fees - $115/ea

$230 - School Ball player and uniform fees

$1,600 - Travel ball player fees - $800/ea

$300 - Indoor facilities practice fees - $10/ea x est.15 practices

$60 - additional uniform fees for travel - $30/ea

$38 - additional uniform fees for rec - $19/ea

$3,400 - weeklong trip/tourney in Puerto Rico, plane/hotel/fees/etc. - est $850 x 4
column2: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, Verdana, Tahoma, sans-serif !important
column13: >What You Get
column19:
>Well, first, you get the satisfaction of contributing to a couple of young dreamers and helping to make those dreams a reality. But, in addition to that, we and the boys have come up with a few incentives for each level of donations. From baseball cards to professional signed prints of each player in action to cool practice shirts and pro jerseys with the boys' logo, there's plenty of swag to go around. And talk about the ultimate rookie card...you'll have the very first baseball card or signed print of these two future big leaguers, dated before they are even out of Elementary and Middle School.

The Impact

The impact. The impact is huge. Baseball with our boys is what has defined our family unit for so long. We are a baseball family. We spend our time together at the field. Our boys love this game, they live it and breathe it, and in turn, their mother and I have come to do the same. The only thing we've taught our boys to put before baseball is God and family. We have not allowed them to play travel ball until this year, mainly because of the financial commitment. Your contribution will allow these two boys to follow their dreams a little further.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that money is tight, and some can't even spare $5. Hey, that's why we're doing this in the first place. If you can't contribute to the boys, you can certainly help by spreading the word. Please share this with as many as you can. Thanks.

column2: >At Awear Underwear we have designed and made premium quality, organic cotton, very sexy, ultra comfortable men’s undies that you can subscribe for.
>To purchase these now, please select a perk pack.

>Our first shipment of small, medium, large and extra large are available in black. We will introduce more colours during 2016.

Awear Underwear is made from Certified sustainaby grown and processed organic cotton and manufactured in fair trade guaranteed workshops so you know they are 100% environmentally sound.

From the outset we new that we wanted to build a business model with 2 distinct aims.

column1: • To create high quality men’s underwear using sustainable, organic cotton and manufactured in, fair trade, work places. To be sold by subscription and delivered every 90 days.
• To donate 50% of our profit to Engineers Without Borders Australia to help fund the incredibly important work they do in developing countries.

Our campaign offers high value perks that represent genuinely good value and offers a real return to our contributors. Men can subscribe for themselves and women can gift them to a man in their lives. The added value is that our contributors will also be making a contribution to Engineers Without Borders Australia.


Why do we love helping EWB? Because their work helps prevent disease in developing countries. EWB runs programs to provide basic water, power and sanitation to villages and communities.

They also provide education and encourage local people to get involved in solutions by becoming entrepreneurs and running small business to roll out solar power modules, sanitation systems, clean water supplies and provide ongoing maintenance to ensure long term benefits to these communities.

This is an example of why we chose to support Engineers Without Borders Australia.
Some of there brilliant work, bringing clean water, electricity,
sanitation and education to a village in Cambodia.

So please become a contributor and support Awear Underwear. You’ll be getting the best men’s underwear that money can buy and you’ll be helping make the world a better place.

My name is Heidi Owens, and I've been making jewelry and painting silk since I was a teenager in the early 80's.  I've placed many things on hold to raise my three beautiful and very artistic daughters, but never gave up my love of beads, stones and silk painting.  As a single mother, I began to do the thing I love most as a way to earn extra income in the spring of 2012, and found myself nominated for accessories designer of the year in Oklahoma City through the RAW Independent artists program by November.
Our lovely friend Kathryn modelling some of our work at the RAWards show in Oklahoma City, November 2013

Our designs are very personal and symbolic.  Every stone, pattern, shape, length... has a meaning.  I am inspired by scripture, nature, people and places, cultures and history.  Our desire is to give our clients a very personal and encouraging piece of wearable art that will always remind them how special they are.

column2: >My mind is always translating the world around me into jewelry, and we have now taken the sun room in our house and turned it in to a studio/workshop.  Over the last twelve months Throne Room Creations was born.  Our concept of custom made, prophetic jewelry has been very warmly received within the local community, which is very precious to us.

>We will be attending our 5th RAW Artists show on September 27th, and our third conference at Glory of Zion in Corinth, Texas on September 5th.  We also have our work in the Galleria Negohot (Treasure Gallery) on NW 10th and Rockwell in Oklahoma City as of August 1st.

column1: Sharing something positive with lovely ladies at a RAW Artists Tulsa show, July 2013. (Photo property of RAW Artists Tulsa and FStopVisual)

column2: >Recently I was invited to take part in San Antonio's Fashion Week this October.  This opportunity is tremendous, and I would love to be able to attend and show a line for Spring/Summer/Resort 2014.  Our theme for the event is: ""The Caravans are Here!"" and is inspired by Middle Eastern tribes.  (I will post more pictures soon!)

column3: >The fee for San Antonio Fashion Week is $750.  There are also materials needed to be able to complete 12 looks to present to the buyers and marketing who will be there, as well as multiples of our pieces and other merchandise to have available.  I would like to be able to use unique materials of excellent quality!  In addition to the fee and materials, we will need to cover travel and hotel expenses for myself and my helper.

column1: The $3000 I am hoping to raise will cover most of that.

My children and I have worked very hard as a family to build our business up from a corner at the dining room table, and this opportunity is the fruit of that hard work. Going to San Antonio's Fashion Week is not only a way to establish our business but also opens a door for us to bring our positive messages to people who wear our jewelry and silk on a much larger scale.  We are working on small story cards to include with our line that explains each piece and shares an encouraging word for whoever it belongs to.

If we don't raise the $3000 in this campaign, we still intend to create the Spring/Summer/Resort 2014 line, and take it to San Antonio on October 21st if possible.  Every opportunity to remind someone that they are beautiful and wonderfully made is important.

We have a tremendous vision to sow into others. Our goal for the future is to mentor young mothers and encourage them to complete their education, follow their creativity, and keep dreaming and aspiring for great things.  We also have a desire to enter into a ""fair trade"" type of relationship with a village in Pakistan and help them establish economy in the village by purchasing fabrics, beads and other things they are able to make.  We hope this will be the first of many projects of this nature.

We have set up some ""thank you for your support"" perks, that I hope will remind you that you are beautiful and designed with a wonderful purpose.  Please feel free to share our link by using the share tools on this page, and pray for us or send your good thoughts our way!  Any support is greatly appreciated!

My name is Heidi Owens, and I've been making jewelry and painting silk since I was a teenager in the early 80's.  I've placed many things on hold to raise my three beautiful and very artistic daughters, but never gave up my love of beads, stones and silk painting.  As a single mother, I began to do the thing I love most as a way to earn extra income in the spring of 2012, and found myself nominated for accessories designer of the year in Oklahoma City through the RAW Independent artists program by November.
Our lovely friend Kathryn modelling some of our work at the RAWards show in Oklahoma City, November 2013

Our designs are very personal and symbolic.  Every stone, pattern, shape, length... has a meaning.  I am inspired by scripture, nature, people and places, cultures and history.  Our desire is to give our clients a very personal and encouraging piece of wearable art that will always remind them how special they are.

My mind is always translating the world around me into jewelry, and we have now taken the sun room in our house and turned it in to a studio/workshop.  Over the last twelve months Throne Room Creations was born.  Our concept of custom made, prophetic jewelry has been very warmly received within the local community, which is very precious to us.

We will be attending our 5th RAW Artists show on September 27th, and our third conference at Glory of Zion in Corinth, Texas on September 5th.  We also have our work in the Galleria Negohot (Treasure Gallery) on NW 10th and Rockwell in Oklahoma City as of August 1st.
Sharing something positive with lovely ladies at a RAW Artists Tulsa show, July 2013. (Photo property of RAW Artists Tulsa and FStopVisual)
The Goal: San Antonio Fashion Week

Recently I was invited to take part in San Antonio's Fashion Week this October.  This opportunity is tremendous, and I would love to be able to attend and show a line for Spring/Summer/Resort 2014.  Our theme for the event is: ""The Caravans are Here!"" and is inspired by Middle Eastern tribes.  (I will post more pictures soon!)

The fee for San Antonio Fashion Week is $750.  There are also materials needed to be able to complete 12 looks to present to the buyers and marketing who will be there, as well as multiples of our pieces and other merchandise to have available.  I would like to be able to use unique materials of excellent quality!  In addition to the fee and materials, we will need to cover travel and hotel expenses for myself and my helper.
The $3000 I am hoping to raise will cover most of that.

My children and I have worked very hard as a family to build our business up from a corner at the dining room table, and this opportunity is the fruit of that hard work. Going to San Antonio's Fashion Week is not only a way to establish our business but also opens a door for us to bring our positive messages to people who wear our jewelry and silk on a much larger scale.  We are working on small story cards to include with our line that explains each piece and shares an encouraging word for whoever it belongs to.

If we don't raise the $3000 in this campaign, we still intend to create the Spring/Summer/Resort 2014 line, and take it to San Antonio on October 21st if possible.  Every opportunity to remind someone that they are beautiful and wonderfully made is important.

We have a tremendous vision to sow into others. Our goal for the future is to mentor young mothers and encourage them to complete their education, follow their creativity, and keep dreaming and aspiring for great things.  We also have a desire to enter into a ""fair trade"" type of relationship with a village in Pakistan and help them establish economy in the village by purchasing fabrics, beads and other things they are able to make.  We hope this will be the first of many projects of this nature.

We have set up some ""thank you for your support"" perks, that I hope will remind you that you are beautiful and designed with a wonderful purpose.  Please feel free to share our link by using the share tools on this page, and pray for us or send your good thoughts our way!  Any support is greatly appreciated!",2.0,0,"1 Campaign

The Strike Zone Project

The Strike Zone Mobile Batting Cage Project is a new concept in batting cages which has never been built before.

Hi, let me introduce myself my name is Kerry Namanny, President of Namanny Sports &
column2:
Entertainment, Inc. located in Cumberland, Iowa. You can check out what we do at www.microreality.com .  Namanny Sports has partnered with the Atlantic High School Marketing class in an Indiegogo Crowdfunding campaign to build a Strike Zone Mobile Batting Cage to be used by both groups.

This is a great opportunity for both Namanny Sports and the Atlantic High School Marketing class to venture into a crowdfunding project. This will show the students what it takes to get funding for a new idea or business venture some time in the future and actually get to work with a business that is doing it. But, we need your HELP to make this a success!

We need your HELP to make this a Success!

column1:
We are trying to raise $85,000.00 to build a Strike Zone Mobile Batting Cage. So, your donations are very important to the success of the campaign. Don't worry you'll be REWARDED for your efforts in Cool Perks. Perks will be sent out 6 to 8 weeks after the campaign has ended.

Check Out the COOL PERKS to the right!!!!

The Funds raised will go to build the Batting cage and pay for all the Perks and a small percentage goes to Indiegogo for managing the campaign. 

If, for some reason, we don't reach the goal we need, the funds will be put into an account and another campaign will be tried again at a later date. Everyone will still receive their Perks. We DO NOT anticipate not meeting our goal.

The Impact

This project will have HUGE impact on the students as they see that with a little guidance anything is possible. They can actually bring their dreams, ideas or ambitions to life with a little help from the community. Plus, create a business opportunity for other Entrepreneurs. All from a High School Marketing Class in Atlantic, IA., Amazing! 

We want to Thank everyone that is involved in this campaign especially Mrs. Hawkins and Dr. Amstein.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute and we understand that, but if you would like to help please ""Spread the Word"" to other people that might not know about it. Make sure to use the Indiegogo share tool.

Hailing from Ye Old Friendly town of Whittier in Southern California, Cris Garza has a passion for helping others as his brand of lifestyle is pay it forward. Wishing to follow his dreams, Cris started a clothing line by coming up with designs that send a message of positivity, self worth, and acceptance for all. He is on a mission to set an example for all his friends and loved ones by doing what he loves:

""I think a lot of people get boggled down and lose hope in their dreams. It's easy to get lost along the way. I'm here to remind others that it's never too late to go for what you want. I want our clothing line to be simple in its approach of helping others to be different and unique. It's really all about being you and thats what being All Around is all about.""

Carlos Antonio Quirarte is a Whittier native born and raised. One thing Carlos knows the value of is hard work and he brings the best of his abilities to any job he has. He began working at the age of 15 when he started doing odd jobs around the neighborhood from cleaning and fixing up houses to helping any of the locals with neighborhood errands. Through his years of hard work he's learned that he loves challenging positions. His passions lie in projects that require him to be hands on from an ideas inception to completion.
""This brand is built on the belief that everyone should embrace their unique personality and that every individual can achieve great things when they are able to stay true to themselves.""

As of now we are in the process of growing and focusing our product on having the best materials and tools to provide our customers with great quality clothing and hand made leather products.

    With your support and contributions you're giving hope to artists that are trying to create a lifestyle brand that gives back to the people. Making clothes that send a positive message of loving yourself is what we're all about. We believe in inspiring ourselves by inspiring others and giving back to the community that help raise us.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you can help us out by:

column2: >Spreading the word about All Around Mfg. on social networking sites such as Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. You can even Snapchat it to your friends if possible, whatever works for you to help us get the word out there.

Thank you!

About this project

The world of watch luxury seems to be an unachievable height for young companies. A lot of people see the industry of luxurious watches and fine watchmaking as something expensive and utopical, but that's not about us! My name is Quentin Trudeau and here's our story.

Ready for shipping!

All watches have been already produced and are ready for shipping to you right after ordering! Don't miss your chance to get Edmonton watches with a discounted price while the Indiegogo campaign is still active.

 

I worked in sales and marketing departments of such watch brands as Breguet, Blancpain, Longines and Ulysse Nardin for almost five years. A lot of beautiful, highly reliable and admirable watches passed through my hands and the only thing that saddened me was its price.

One day I decided to move forward with this watch passion of mine and create something on my own, use my experience to make watches that distinctively stand out among others. That's exactly when I thought of my long time fellow Vikentiy Gryaznov.

My partner and friend Vikentiy Gryaznov is a talented and renowned designer who worked for several Swiss watch companies and well known for his assistance in the masterpiece Lunokhod watch project of famous Russian watchmaker Konstantin Chaykin. 

Vikentiy has studied at Strate School of design in Paris and graduated in 2008 with specialization in luxury design. Besides luxurious watches he also works on jewelry, furniture, car interiors and yachts. He gladly agreed to unite his creative genius with my aspirations and since we've been working together as a team.

We attracted to the project some of our friends, who are professionals in luxury industry, to act as our consultants and advisers, which helps us to see market clearly and turn our big dream into reality. 

Well... that's how it started.

 

Working with luxury timepieces, we, of course, studied their history as well as watch industry as a whole. Let's be frank: we're extremely fond of vintage watches, a good old fashioned classic. That became our destination in design concept for the first series of Plan B.

We searched through enormous collections of the most attractive vintage timepieces of the past, thousands of photographs and whittled away all of our pencils on sketches before we came up with the final design of Plan B - Edmonton series.

It has everything that warms hearts of watch enthusiasts all over the world, trusted design features, traditional outlook with every element seems natural and hand made.

We spent almost two years developing an ideal prototype to show it to the world and to you.

Cherishing quality in every detail and basic ideas of European watch design of the middle of XX century, our designer Vikentiy Gryaznov developed three models for the first Plan B series - Edmonton - which is an ultimate manifestation of our philosophy.

Realizing our aspirations, we've reached an agreement with a manufacturer specializing on producing watches for the luxury segment. With such an ambitious task in mind we have no rights to loose in quality. For you - only the best we can offer!

Our main goal was to create a timepiece based on three fundamental ideas: vintage design, functionality and universality. That's the essentials of our concept which combines the best designer features of the most attractive luxury timepieces, has the same accuracy and reliability as its bourgeois brethren, but with reasonable price affordable for everyone.

And of course, it's the timepiece we gladly wear ourselves!

We wanted not only to create beautiful and attractive watch with vintage design but also make it an inherent companion to your wrists, a stylish decision for every occasion. That's why we offer second, more formal stainless steel strap, which is included in the original package. Now you'll always have a Plan B!

To complete package and make strap changing process easy as possible we also include special tool which allow you to change straps in couple of seconds! Plan B offers you an opportunity to have a universal timepiece suitable for every situation in one box.

Our first project is only the beginning. If you like our watches, have faith in what we do and ready to support us then we'll gladly march forward with our cause!

We want to make Plan B the big player in the watch industry, improving manufacturing technologies, reliability, quality and design, matching it with the top watch brands. We have a lot of ideas how to make our watches better, more advanced, complicated and sophisticated.

 

One of our top achievements in development of Plan B is that we've managed to bring life into the watch with small and interesting details. We used several types of steel to create the diversity in textures and feeling. Case itself has matte coating, while crown, buttons and strap parts are made of polished steel. Watch hands have brushed surface along with outer rings of sunray concentric sub-dials. 

The dial has applied volume index marks covered with luminous paint and consists of three independent layers, each with its own time unit to show.

One of the coolest features is a domed mineral glass which lets to read the dial most spectacular way and supports overall vintage outlook. Date window has a magnifying lens on itself.

Edmonton Noir is a special limited edition of our Plan B watches. It has black brushed steel dial with handcrafted black date window and stylish green luminous coating. Noir comes with a black genuine leather strap and black steel mesh band. There will be only 50 pieces of Edmonton Noir.

Plan B case has an aerodynamic rounded shape inspired with french watchmaking of mid 1950-s and made of high grade composite stainless steel - the best material available in our price range. It is topped with domed panoramic glass which lets you enjoy Edmonton series vintage design in its full beauty. 

By the way the case was created from scratch, through a lot of research and hot debates. Every single detail was developed thoroughly, even the shape of lugs! Precision and reliability of prime watch function is also a vital matter for us. Plan B watches house accurate quartz movement with two chronographs, four jewels and gold coating. Also an outstanding battery life terms — 54 months! We love what we do so much that we spent a lot of time picking most comfy and convenient watch crown and chrono buttons!

Our project means frequent strap change, so we needed to find lasting and durable decision for our straps. That's why we've picked dyed canvas and leather for basic strap and Milanese mesh steel for secondary one. These kinds of straps can easily last for ages even if you are going to change them on your Plan B every day!

Case Diameter: 43 mm 
Case Thickness: 9 mm 
Band Material: Dyed canvas/leather and Milanese mesh stainless steel
Band Max/Min Length: 215 mm / 155 mm 
Band Width: 20 mm 
Total Weight: 55 gr
Case / Backcase Material : 316L Stainless steel 
Strap buckle: 316L Stainless steel 
Glass: Crystal Mineral glass 
Water Resistant: 5 ATM / 50 Meters
Movement:  Quartz

Our backers will have the sweetest deals! We have a possibility to offer the best price on our watch as well as make this deal even more profitable. Save up to 50% ordering more than one Plan B set! 

 

Plan B is an ambitious project which needs help of crowdfunding to hit the market. But if you can't support our cause with funds you can still influence the fate of Plan B watches with your digital voice! Please, share our watches with your friends, tell them about us and make it happen! Our success is in your hands. And your feeds :)

instagram.com/planb.watch

facebook.com/planb.watches

twitter.com/planb_watch

Our team may be small in numbers but quite big in experience and ambitions. We want you to know who stands behind our Plan B.

I, Quenitn Trudeau, founder of Wrist Works Company and Vikentiy Gryaznov, lead designer, are main characters in the story of Plan B watches, but we also want to mention other people who were involved in development process, helped us on our way to the first prototypes: Marie Elenberg, Eric Drouglazet, Kevin Egalite, Thierry Carel and Catherine Dagron.

You can find high resolution images for personal use and sharing through media resources at our Flickr page.

 For other press-related issues contact us: info@planb.watch

Produced with superior quality, VVCO certainly comes with highly affordable price. After a year of prudent planning and development, our first collection SERIES 8XX1 is launched. The timeless beauty does not only excel in appearance but also quality. In order to ensure quality of our product, our team cooperate with a highly professional and accomplished manufacturer with almost 20 years of expertise in the traditional watchmaking industry. Our passion does not allow us to merely deliver, but to devote and care.


316L stainless steel, which is extremely resistant to corrosion such as seawater, is grade of stainless steel with extra-low carbon content. SERIES 8XX1 is 10ATM water-resistant, which is equal to 100 meters water resistant. This feature allows user to wear the watch on occasions like swimming and snorkeling, let alone everyday use.


Fine polished 316L stainless steel bezel.


Brushed finish of 316L stainless steel case, contrasting with the fine polished bezel and the polished edge of lug, providing the watch with an elegant appearance.


Screwed down stainless steel case back with sapphire crystal.

The heart of Series 8XX1 is MIYOTA JAPAN 820A Automatic Movement, fine polished version of MIYOTA 8205.
- 21600 vibrations per hour
- 21 Jewels
- Day-Date Calendar
- Uni-directional winding system
- Automatic &
column2:
manual winding
- Power reserve, over 40 hours from full winding



316L stainless steel screwed down crown by diamond cutting. The unique oversized design allows easy manual winding.


Domed sapphire crystal with anti-reflective coating, projecting a smooth curve across the surface.


Like other luxury watch brands, we use sapphire crystal because of its scratch-resistant property. Moreover, we lower the light reflection by applying anti-reflective coating, allowing more comfortable use under direct sunlight.


Fine polished hands with Swiss SuperLumiNova Luminous, which is widely used by famous luxury watch brands.


Handmade tapered genuine leather strap with fine polished 316L stainless steel butterfly buckle. The buckle is with a push button, allowing easy lifting of the watch.











VVCO watches are warranted to all backers for two years. The warranty covers material and manufacturing defects including the hands, dial, and watch movement.

*The warranty does not cover case, crystal, straps, scratches or any damages arising from normal wear, accidents, or water damage (unless marked water-resistant.).


Select a reward for any watch(es) in our collection. You’ll receive a survey to specify color later.
Remark:
Potential import taxes might be imposed by your government and we can’t predict any possible duties/taxes that may be required in your country. Duties &
column3:
taxes are not included and are the responsibility of the Backer.


We need your support! Share our idea to others and spread the word out!

Facebook: www.facebook.com/vvcowatch


Instagram: www.instagram.com/vvcowatch


Twitter: www.twitter.com/vvcowatch

Risks and challenges

Having envisioned possible challenges in the manufacturing process, our team is well prepared for that. We are experienced and prepared to deal with order fulfillment. Contingency plans on all steps of the production process have been designed in case the processes become out of control. To increase the transparency of production process, backers would be updated regularly on the progress, including notification on unfortunate setback or delay in production. However, we are very confident that such occurrences would be minimal and the products would exceed our backers’ expectation! 
Once again, thank you for your support. Please remember to share and pledge so that this premium quality watch can be made a reality! You are essential to the successful launching of VVCO watches!

 

 

 

 

 

","Produced with superior quality, VVCO certainly comes with highly affordable price. After a year of prudent planning and development, our first collection SERIES 8XX1 is launched. The timeless beauty does not only excel in appearance but also quality. In order to ensure quality of our product, our team cooperate with a highly professional and accomplished manufacturer with almost 20 years of expertise in the traditional watchmaking industry. Our passion does not allow us to merely deliver, but to devote and care.316L stainless steel, which is extremely resistant to corrosion such as seawater, is grade of stainless steel with extra-low carbon content. SERIES 8XX1 is 10ATM water-resistant, which is equal to 100 meters water resistant. This feature allows user to wear the watch on occasions like swimming and snorkeling, let alone everyday use.Fine polished 316L stainless steel bezel.Brushed finish of 316L stainless steel case, contrasting with the fine polished bezel and the polished edge of lug, providing the watch with an elegant appearance.Screwed down stainless steel case back with sapphire crystal.The heart of Series 8XX1 is MIYOTA JAPAN 820A Automatic Movement, fine polished version of MIYOTA 8205.- 21600 vibrations per hour- 21 Jewels- Day-Date Calendar- Uni-directional winding system- Automatic & manual winding- Power reserve, over 40 hours from full winding316L stainless steel screwed down crown by diamond cutting. The unique oversized design allows easy manual winding.Domed sapphire crystal with anti-reflective coating, projecting a smooth curve across the surface.Like other luxury watch brands, we use sapphire crystal because of its scratch-resistant property. Moreover, we lower the light reflection by applying anti-reflective coating, allowing more comfortable use under direct sunlight.Fine polished hands with Swiss SuperLumiNova Luminous, which is widely used by famous luxury watch brands.Handmade tapered genuine leather strap with fine polished 316L stainless steel butterfly buckle. The buckle is with a push button, allowing easy lifting of the watch.VVCO watches are warranted to all backers for two years. The warranty covers material and manufacturing defects including the hands, dial, and watch movement.*The warranty does not cover case, crystal, straps, scratches or any damages arising from normal wear, accidents, or water damage (unless marked water-resistant.).Select a reward for any watch(es) in our collection. You’ll receive a survey to specify color later.Remark:Potential import taxes might be imposed by your government and we can’t predict any possible duties/taxes that may be required in your country. Duties & taxes are not included and are the responsibility of the Backer.We need your support! column2: >Same Old Expressions - Who they hell are we?

column1:
Simply put, we are a company that believes unflinchingly in transparency about our faults, being purposeful (our purpose is NOT our side hustle), and the highest level of commitment (we call that quality assurance in blood).

This campaign is meant to put these beliefs to the test. This campaign is meant to put our ideas and product into the world and see if you agree that this is worth starting.

HOW TO GET INVOLVED: If what you've read and what you've seen speaks to you, if you're into what's going on here whether from a conscious stand point, or because it's just your style of fun, then ... choose the perk level you want based on how many designs you want (1-6). After you select the tier and pay, I'll message you directly and get the exact designs you want and the sizes you want.

column2: >100% Organic cotton - because cotton is 4% of the world's crops, yet accounts for 25% of the world's pesticide use (that sits on your body, all day, impacts the world, and those that work in the fields)

column1: Locally Designed in Crown Heights - aka I'm either on my couch or elsewhere in BK doodling, then I scan it, auto-trace, send to the printer, pick up my shirts a few days later
Locally Printed at BKNY Printing - the short coming here is that the ink is plastisol which is not earth friendly like water based inks. But as you'll read later on, we won't hide our faults.
Since our values are some of the main reasons we think you'll end up giving a sh*t about what we got going on, check out the short explanations below before you get into the designs.

Yet even the most conscious companies really only focus on the sunny side of their efforts.

We at Same Old Expressions believe that there is too much to be learned and shared from failure and mistake to keep them to ourselves. As well, everyone and everything is a product of the good and the bad, so why try and pretend any company is all good? or hell, even all bad?

We will be 100% transparent about . . .
• Platisol ink (not earth friendly like water based inks)
• Designed on a sheet of paper and styled in Illustrator

What your money is going towards - costs, re-investment, profit, donations, all of it
  • For this campaign it is all reinvested in the company, but you will receive a breakdown of where your money went upon the successful completion of the campaign

Tests we run, why we ran them, the results 
  • Right now, this is the test

What we learn along the way
  • Looking forward to check'n back with you here

column2: >​everything right and wrong with what we do, when we do it

column1: What we stand for, why we exist, and why we think you just might want to give a sh*t, will never be hard to discern.

Out of the gate, we stand for these 3 principles and believe that if this value system permeated other companies we would all be living in a far different world.

Our purpose will develop over time, but before we go saving the world one organic t-shirt at a time, we're going to focus on a successful launch, then take it from there.

We would never ask you to put our designs on your body if we didn't whole heartedly believe in them.

Designs will have a set goal. Once sales reach that number I will be getting that design tattooed on my body.

It's not a gimmick, but instead, it is our ""quality assured in blood"" to you. This is a chance for you to participate in the direct reflection of our commitment to you, in a way that no other company allows people to participate. 

Want in? Then bear with me, keep on reading on . . .

column2: >Quality Assured in Blood - The Tattoo Goal

column1:
In this crowd funding campaign, each contribution will be your active vote and participation in the process. Each shirt you purchase is your vote for the winning design. The first of many designs to be assured in blood.

1. Choose your contribution tier based on the number of shirts you want to get
2. Then, I will follow up to get all of the details about . . .
. . . and keep the tally going as we count down to $2400.
The design with the most contributions will be the tattoo that I get. As well, any design that gets greater than 23* contributions will also become a tattoo on my body.

Because it allows me to produce shirts in the next tier of reduced costs from the company that I get the 100% organic shirts from, and from the local printer that we work with. Thus, those cost reductions will be reinvested in our commitments to you and the community.

column2: >Our goals and aims are bigger than this, but this is where we start.
>It would be an honor if what we stand for resonates with you.
>Honesty: Where the money goes - each shirt

column1:
. . . From there I will follow up to discuss the specific plans of where the difference between the costs to me and the costs to you go. This clarity down to the exact fraction of a penny is crucial to me. I want you to know exactly what you've invested in because that's what you're doing, investing. 

You are investing in a company, in an idea, in a future populated by the type of businesses and people that you want to see.

HOW TO GET INVOLVED: If what you've read and what you've seen speaks to you, if you're into what's going on here whether from a conscious stand point, or because it's just your style of fun, then ... choose the perk level you want based on how many designs you want (1-6). After you select the tier and pay, I'll message you directly and get the exact designs you want and the sizes you want.

column2: >FINALLY!!! DESIGNS!!! FEAST YOHHH EYES ON THESE MULL SUCKAHS!!!!

column1: 1. George Washington Wore A Weave - If one of the world's most revered leaders can achieve that position with a powdered wig fastened to his dome, then you can too! This homage to GW pokes fun at a now defunct style, but is meant to highlight that what you wear matters, but what matters more is how you rock it. So, shoulders back . . . tits out . . . do you, because realistically GW wore a weave (like, he actually did wear an actual weave y'all).

column2: >

column1: 2. Don't Tread on I - What you said, has been said before. So say it differently, SAY IT BETTER! Don't tread on me? Nah, sonion, DONT TREAD ON I. Revolutionary Rasta Snake (the rasta flag crown, Jamaican flag pattern on the snake, and rasta colored rattler) pays tribute to one people that say everyday phrases in a way that's just better. If I've said it once, I'll say it again, it's been said before. SAY IT BETTER.

column2: >3. I ❤️️ The Idea of NY - I ❤️️ NY? Sure, maybe. But, if you've lived here for any period of time you really get the feeling that the best part about New York is the idea of New York. It takes a special breed to love a city where finding a solid pile of human poop on your subway car is not as uncommon as you might expect, or what seems like a strategically placed gaggle of tourists looking directly up in the sky at seemingly nothing snapping their 150th picture while you're just trying to get to where you're going (at lightspeed walking pace), or hell, the family of rats that live in your apartment wall that your slum lord swears isn't his problem. In the end, all of this is ❤️️  worthy, but the idea of the city that never sleeps, that's what we're all here for.

column1: 4. Mustard on the Beet - is pretty objectively simple and potentially stupid, but it's what started this whole jam. Messing around with friends, stuck in the catchy trance that only DJ Mustard can deliver, I wanted to pay homage to ""Mustard on the beat,"" in the most figuratively literal way I could think of.

5. Frank Ocean - Is in a similar vein to Young Mustard aka Dijon J, aka Family Size Poupon. I started playing around with other peoples' names and settled on ""hot dog on oceanic sunrise,"" aka Frank Ocean.

6. Marl-Bro - Ever been to a grocery store and tried to read a label full of fake words with no regulation that is meant to make you ""feel"" healthier. Me too, well fu*k that. This shirt calls that reality out by applying words from the FDA that could actually legally be used to describe a pack of cigarettes due to the lack of legal regulation any of these words actually have . . .as always, Keep it 100's.

As you've read in the perks section, the perks come with these ""packs"" so I elaborated on what they are below.

 

Thank You Daps Pack - This comes with every tier and will be stuffed with little personal touches from us to you saying danke, grazie, 谢谢, and good lookin out.

 

Fitting Pack - Whether you're buying more clothes for you, for a friend, or whoever it is we're going to be sending some essentials for more precise future fitting and self-measuring. Again, these will come with some touches. What's that mean? You'll see.

 

Cleaning Samples - Most companies want your stuff to be dunzo quick. This way you can buy more of their crap faster. Plus, a lot of the destruction to this world comes in the cleaning process, so we're going to send you a pack of some products that can help maintain your stuff, your health, and the world in the process. Dope? Right?

>HOW TO GET HOW TO GET INVOLVED: If what you've read and what you've seen speaks to you, if you're into what's going on here whether from a conscious stand point, or because it's just your style of fun, then ... choose the perk level you want based on how many designs you want (1-6). After you select the tier and pay, I'll message you directly and get the exact designs you want and the sizes you want.
>WHICH DESIGNS WILL TURN INTO QA IN BLOOD?

column1: As contributions come through, I will send out an update in comments keeping the tally  up to date as the numbers climb, plus I will update right here so that if you love a design, and or just want to mess with me and make your vote count, then peep this section or the updates to keep tabs . . .

Missconstrued is not only a brand, Missconstrued Boutique &
column2:
Gallery is a home for over 70+ local artists to sell their work, promote, and collaborate! Our collective dream is to share art with the world through our brand and to also help other artists reach that same goal. This is what this campaign is all about! 5 artists have come together to support each other reach their goals with the support of our fans, friends, customers and peers! 

Tier 1 funding: $7,500

Our Ultimate goal: $10,000.00
column4:
'/>
Arizona recently just made national headlines for its growth in self-expression which continues to flourish. Missconstrued provides a home to several entrepreneurs who promote local exchange, and in turn, employ artists and students!  Our vision is to create handmade art and accessories at affordable prices. We have heavy support locally, it’s time to show the world that we can reach our goals and achieve our dreams. WE’RE ALMOST THERE!!

This year, we have decided it is time to try to get our brands seen by the buyers from all over the world at the WWD Magic Expo this coming August.  We decided to place our booth inside the POOL Tradeshow in Las Vegas. You can find information about this tradeshow here: http://www.magiconline.com/pooltradeshow

 Our goal is to hit the mainstream market and get to finally get  our art, accessories, fashion and the Missconstrued  snapbacks in front of retailers before some big name designer steals our ideas from underneath us! Our designers have had proven sales, and I alone have worked through 7 years of schooling, a full time job, and a full time business with little sleep to get where I am today. Now it is time to push our brands out to the ultimate market to be able to concentrate on our dreams full time while also being able to employ and support other local artists! 

My fellow brands such as Torture Couture, Modifiedminds, El Vaquero Muerto and Pink Moon Prophecy will be coming with Missconstrued to help promote as a team. How awesome is that!!? With all that talent under one roof, how can we NOT make an impression?!  These brands have graciously agreed to participate in this fundraiser to provide you a wide range of options for your contribution!

Here they are! The perks for your contribution! Choose from the following and more!
column6:
'> ** NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/08/2014 - Sinner Collection!

** NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/08/2014 - Batty Pasties!

**NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/11/2014 - Partiers of the Universe by El Vaquero Muerto: 

**NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/16/2014 - Pretty Dead Things and Gun Spider Tee!!

**NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/18/2014 - Lolita Sunnies!

**NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/25/2014 - LSP GICLEE Print!



 

 

 

 

**NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/11/2014 - The Dark Side by El Vaquero Muerto:
column8:
'>Every $1,000 raised, we will UNLOCK a NEW Perk! Each one is a limited stock as well, so as certain perks are maxed out, new ones will be released!

Even if we don’t reach our goal to cover all costs, the funds will help us get that much closer. We will still have two more months to promote, and work hard at coming as close as we can! Every dollar helps us make this dream a reality! THERE IS NO TURNING BACK! We are determined to see this project through to the end and in fact, have already signed our contract to have space reserved for us in August.
column10:
'/>

When you support us by ordering one of our perks, not only will you get your exclusive merchandise, but you will also help us realising our dream. Your pledge will help us to finally get our label out in the U.S market, and to the rest of the world. Thats a win+win!!

The $7,500.00 goal is for the bare minimum to fund our booth and all the necessary materials that go with it! Our ultimate goal is $10,000, which will also help fund our manufacturing of our product after the orders come in!

Here is what it will take for us to push our brand to the national and international level:

Magic Pool Tradeshow Booth Package: $4,500

Promotional Materials (Buttons, Business Cards and Flyers): $700.00

Hotel and Travel Costs: $1500.00

Costs for Signs, banners and branding materials: $800.00
column12:
'/>

MAGIC is the largest global marketplace for contemporary men’s and women’s apparel, footwear, accessories and sourcing resources — and the world’s most comprehensive forum for fashion buyers and brands. Every February and August, the industry convenes in Las Vegas for connection, inspiration and to shop a portfolio of ten expertly merchandised and curated shows across every category, trend and price point. With more than $200 million in orders written daily, MAGIC fuels the business of fashion. THIS IS OUR CHANCE TO MAKE MOVES! Help us put Arizona on the map!!

Even if you feel you cannot contribute financially, you can still help this campaign succeed:

**Share  our campaign verbally**
And by email with your friends, family, and co-workers!! Let everyone know that you believe in us!

**Share and like us on**
The following social media platforms:

TESTIMONIALS:

You can find information about this tradeshow here: http://www.magiconline.com/pooltradeshow Our goal is to hit the mainstream market and get to finally get  our art, accessories, fashion and the Missconstrued  snapbacks in front of retailers before some big name designer steals our ideas from underneath us! Our designers have had proven sales, and I alone have worked through 7 years of schooling, a full time job, and a full time business with little sleep to get where I am today. Now it is time to push our brands out to the ultimate market to be able to concentrate on our dreams full time while also being able to employ and support other local artists! My fellow brands such as Torture Couture, Modifiedminds, El Vaquero Muerto and Pink Moon Prophecy will be coming with Missconstrued to help promote as a team. How awesome is that!!? With all that talent under one roof, how can we NOT make an impression?!  These brands have graciously agreed to participate in this fundraiser to provide you a wide range of options for your contribution!Here they are! The perks for your contribution! Choose from the following and more! ** NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/08/2014 - Sinner Collection!** NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/08/2014 - Batty Pasties!**NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/11/2014 - Partiers of the Universe by El Vaquero Muerto: **NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/16/2014 - Pretty Dead Things and Gun Spider Tee!!**NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/18/2014 - Lolita Sunnies!**NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/25/2014 - LSP GICLEE Print!    **NEW PERK UNLOCKED 07/11/2014 - The Dark Side by El Vaquero Muerto: Every $1,000 raised, we will UNLOCK a NEW Perk! Each one is a limited stock as well, so as certain perks are maxed out, new ones will be released!Even if we don’t reach our goal to cover all costs, the funds will help us get that much closer. We will still have two more months to promote, and work hard at coming as close as we can! Every dollar helps us make this dream a reality! THERE IS NO TURNING BACK! We are determined to see this project through to the end and in fact, have already signed our contract to have space reserved for us in August.When you support us by ordering one of our perks, not only will you get your exclusive merchandise, but you will also help us realising our dream. Your pledge will help us to finally get our label out in the U.S market, and to the rest of the world. Thats a win+win!!The $7,500.00 goal is for the bare minimum to fund our booth and all the necessary materials that go with it! Our ultimate goal is $10,000, which will also help fund our manufacturing of our product after the orders come in!Here is what it will take for us to push our brand to the national and international level: Magic Pool Tradeshow Booth Package: $4,500Promotional Materials (Buttons, Business Cards and Flyers): $700.00Hotel and Travel Costs: $1500.00Costs for Signs, banners and branding materials: $800.00MAGIC is the largest global marketplace for contemporary men’s and women’s apparel, footwear, accessories and sourcing resources — and the world’s most comprehensive forum for fashion buyers and brands. Every February and August, the industry convenes in Las Vegas for connection, inspiration and to shop a portfolio of ten expertly merchandised and curated shows across every category, trend and price point. With more than $200 million in orders written daily, MAGIC fuels the business of fashion. THIS IS OUR CHANCE TO MAKE MOVES! Help us put Arizona on the map!!Even if you feel you cannot contribute financially, you can still help this campaign succeed:**Share  our campaign verbally**And by email with your friends, family, and co-workers!! Let everyone know that you believe in us!**Share and like us on**The following social media platforms:TESTIMONIALS:",20.0,0,"2 Campaigns

column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

ABOVE YOU WILL HEAR THE JINGLE TO THE CLOTHING LINE AND PICTURES OF OUR DasHuh TEES WE PLAN TO DISPLAY AT THE COBB SHOW IN ATL, ENJOY!

Short Summary

My name is Shannon Graham and I’m the owner of a clothing  line entitled, “ DasHuh/DasHim Apparel"" and the Coach of a non profit 501(c)3 organization named DasHuh Basketball Foundation.  DasHuh/DasHim are terms that are mostly part of a southern dialect which means “That’s her/That’s him"". So in other words, when she’s sporting her outfit and looking cute, loving life and emitting her confidence, all they can say is “DasHuh!” and when he dresses and look smooth and debonair and motivated to take on the world, all they can say is “DasHim!"" The best thing about the names is they are not just colloquials, they are acronyms(described in video). This campaign is important to me because 1) kids whom are business minded will be given the opportunity to work on the business side of the apparel line thus allowing them to flex their ‘inner entrepreneur’ they probably don’t know exists within, 2) a percentage of the sales generated from this fun, and ambitious apparel line, will fund the non-profit to cover travel expenses of the kids, 3) it will help future  philanthropy acts of DasHuh Basketball Foundation where we plan to prepare business classes for kids to teach them about money, investing and how to run a business. Your contributions to help get this apparel line launched will be used as a gateway for my non-profit to continue to teach life skills and teach them the importance of securing their financial futures.

What We Need &
column7:
What You Get

I am currently seeking a minimum of $17,000 to assist with the costs of attending the Cobb Show which is an apparel trade show held in Atlanta, Ga in July 2014, where the funds will be used to pay the Cobb Show contract, obtain much needed inventory of our branded DasHuh  tees and “CUTEsuits” (fleece suits) so I can present them to potential buyers such as Macy’s, Dillards, Neiman Marcus, etc…, fulfill the bulk orders expected from the show, distribution and continuous advertising.

The perks you will receive for contributing to the success of the clothing line: 

You will be mentioned on our social network pages, mailed  free “I’m
Dat Chic” rally rags, DasHuh T-shirts and  DasHuh Sweatsuit from our line,  free exclusive tees from our upcoming DasHim line, free custom DasHuh watch, a DasHuh logo signature basketball of all the players, you/your company’s picture/logo posted as a contributor on the DasHuh/DasHim Apparel website, and a phone call thanking you personally for your generous contribution.

Even if I don’t reach my entire goal, I will still use the contributed funds towards the clothing line for the Cobb show and will continue to push forward into making an impact in kids lives.

The Impact

Your contributions to help this clothing line will give you a sense of value knowing your efforts will give kids an opportunity to advance
the education level whether its via college and/or  entrepreneurialship. Wouldn’t it make you feel good to know you assisted a kids to college or helped them fund their OWN business(es) by aiding DasHuh/DasHim Apparel which will in turn fund DasHuh Basketball Foundation where scholarships/investment funds will be offered to ambitious kids? Wouldn’t it make you feel good to know because of your contributions, that kids will be taught how to GIVE BACK thus be like YOU and help someone else on their way? I’ve been working for years, via basketball, showing kids that with work, ANYTHING is possible. Below are two testimonials from former players whom came through my basketball program who initially thought going to college was not possible: 

Honestly, if it wasnt for  DasHuh Basketball Foundation  wouldn't be where I am today. I wouldn’t have had full basketball scholarship, the life skills that were instilled in me by DasHuh Basketball Foundation has assisted me into becoming the young woman I am today. I just recently graduated college with a 3.0 gpa in Biology and I’m planning to attend grad school for Physical Therapy. DHBF has taught me lessons that has taken me WAY beyond the basketball court. Lessons of teamwork, friendship, leadership, communication, responsibility, and many more! The climb to getting to where I am was a tough but fun one and I would GLADLY do it again
in a heartbeat. The members of DHBF will forever and always be considered my FAMILY♥ - Carol Ruiz- lopez

DHB is an acronym for DasHuh Basketball Foundation that was
originated by Shannon Graham after her clothing line. When I first joined the
foundation my only goal and focus was to develop into a great basketball player
that would surpass my potential. Not only did I gain the knowledge and the
skills to become a successful basketball player, Coach Shannon also instilled
in us the importance of life and what opportunities lie ahead. Some of the
lessons I learned playing under her was first, not everything was going to be
handed to me on a silver platter. We had a lot of outside people looking in
doubting our foundation and thinking we were up to no good. No one saw the timeand effort that it took. In order for the good and positive results to come out of this program, we found out quick it was going to require hard work and
dedication. I, myself took that as a challenge and was forced to work my butt
off on and off the court to see progression. Every day, whether it was a
practice day or an individual I had scheduled with her, I gave it my full
effort. Another lesson Coach Shannon has taught me was to have each of my
teammate’s backs. Every line we had to run whether it was one person that
messed up or the whole team, nothing was accepted until we as a whole
succeeded. That’s how we became a successful team and basketball organization by not letting anyone fail by working together. The final lesson I learned was when to bite my tongue. I can admit, I always had something to say whether it was an excuse or an unwanted opinion. She quickly taught me that to earn respect I had to give respect. She wasn’t afraid to kick me out of practice or bench me, even if it meant costing us a game. That taught me that I wasn’t above the team, that even if I was the “best player” I still had to earn my spot, and not just by playing, but by being a good teammate and being “coachable”. To me, that was the biggest lesson I learned, to be coachable. That is the one lesson that is prevalent in everything I do: college ball, classes, clinical and work experience. If I hadn’t learned how to deal with constructive criticism, teamwork and hard work, than I would not have earned a full basketball scholarship, been voted captain of our team and graduated Cum Laude from SCC. Thank you Coach Shannon for believing in me even when I didn’t believe in myself –Machera Calhoun

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to visit our website: www.dashuh.com to learn more about us. Even if you can’t contribute financially, I ask that you post this campaign on your FB page, twitter, Instagram,  youtube, any social media.

Seek us out on our various social media outlets

 

For DasHuh Basketball Foundation:

LIKE us: www.facebook.com/dashuhbasketball

column1:
TWEET us: Twitter.com/dashuhbball - @DasHuhbball

SHARE with us: instagram.com/dashuh_basketball - @dashuh_basketball

 

 

 

                                                               www.dashuh.com

                                EVERY PURCHASE IMPACTS A KIDS FUTURE!

column2:
>

                     SHOP NOW at Retro Mountain

column1: Retro Mountain is a modern take on the mad ski suits of the 80s and 90s. Many of the originals are chilly on the cold days, soggy on the wet days and fit like a brightly coloured bin bag (in the coolest possible way!) Retro Mountain has addressed all these issues to create a truly unique and striking yet technical and comfortable range of one piece skiwear.
• Graduated insulation to regulate your body temperature
• YKK aqua-seal zips to keep the weather well and truly out
• Thumb mitts to keep the snow out and your sleeves down
• Removable hoods and faux fur trim on the girls suits
• As it is a one piece design, when you inevitably stack it showing off to your mates, you won't get any snow up your back or down your trousers!

As exciting news goes we think a SHOP ON THE KINGS ROAD is pretty big! We are creating an Apres Ski bar in the heart of Chelsea on one of London's most prestigious roads with a number of fantastic partners to kick off the ski season in absolute style.  It's going to be big so make sure you are there. Lots of alpine cocktails, music and of course retro skiwear. We open our doors at 340 Kings Road on November 16th, its going to be Bold, Brave and offensively Retro!

Our first season was amazing with lots of sales to all corners of the world. As we had to reinvest most of our revenue in to digital marketing and brand visibility, we now need a cash injection to order our next load of stock, increase our digital marketing and PR and focus on a few key events leading up to the next season. We have a lot of exciting collaborations being planned both for the UK and French Alps, all we need is the backing to bring those plans to fruition. Thats where YOU come in!

Our skiwear range is expanding along with a super secret Jacuzzi range which is due to be launched later this year. We are really excited to get our unique products out to a hugely lucrative and exciting market of young, outgoing holiday addicts with a love for all things retro and stylish.
'Such a fan...not only awesome but also really warm. Really good quality and not at a bad price either...' Emma
'These are so great, nothing better than a bit of retro on the slopes, well done guys"" Ben

Well usually yes they are but not in this case. We realised that onesies are worn by loads of skiers not only because they are AWESOME but also because they're quite practical. They stop the breeze getting where it shouldn't and they keep the snow out. We've designed our skiwear to exceed current standards so you can ensure that you'll be toasty warm and dry all day.

Just bung it in the washing machine on a 30 degree wash, hang it up to dry (this can take a while because of the insulation and layers but it will dry) and it'll look as good as new. Girls make sure you take the hood and faux fur trims off just to stop the fur getting everywhere.
We do indeed. We want to make Retro Mountain as accessible as possible to skiers whether they ski in France or New Zealand.

Helen Shortall - PR and Press enquiries
