But Kore belts are different. Our track system, sewn into the back of the belt, has 40+ micro size positions to adjust with - each just ¼” apart. It actually locks to your exact waist size every time you slide it on. It’s the best-fitting, most comfortable belt you will ever wear.
column58:
s=d15f9f041378e40e32274c781ef43b51"" src=""""/>

For the first time ever, we’re introducing 4 solid, grade 1 titanium ratchet buckles. Each buckle features a 2 millimeter thick body, with alloy undercarriage (1.5 to 2 oz. total weight). Titanium is one of the strongest, lightest metals known to man, and used to make rocket ships and supersonic jets.  These buckles do a lot more than just look good.
column66:
s=584ee1bc22995de2402dc26473a16c2d"" src=""""/>

The Leather is Full-Grain (1-3/8 inches or 35mm wide) and chrome tanned to resist the fading and scratching you get from vegetable tanning.  Full-Grain is the highest grade of leather and actually improves with age.
column74:

Next we added a proprietary Flex-Core center for added durability and strength.  This strong, fibrous core ads strength and extends the belt life. Backers can choose between classic or pebble-grain in black or brown.

Each belt comes extra long and in One-Size that FITS ANY waist size from 24” to 44”. You trim it to your size in minutes with household scissors. Simply locate your pant size on the back of the belt using the Printed Ruler Marks (no measuring needed).  Add 4 inches and cut. Then clamp the belt into the buckle and wear. If the belt is too long, remove the buckle and cut off another inch. It's that easy.

column1: The new Kore Tek Belt features Grade 1 Titanium Buckles, Full-Grain Leather Belts with Flex-Core™ center and our micro track with more adjustment ability (40+ size positions) than any other ratchet belt.                                                                                                           Welcome to our 4th IndieGoGo Project !  In 2013, we introduced our first Kore track belts (then Trakline Belts) and set a crowdfunding record for fashion accessories. Since then we’ve sold over 100,000 belts worldwide.But our goal isn’t to sell the most belts – it’s to sell the best.  Introducing the  >> WORLD’S FIRST  TITANIUM  TRACK  BELT.  THIS PROJECT HAS ENDED GET A BELT ON OUR WEBSITE  >>  KORE ESSENTIALS   Why’s all this such a big deal? Because throughout the day as you work, walk, eat, sleep and play, your waist size fluctuates - in a little – or out a little in small increments. That’s why traditional belts with 5 holes don’t work. The holes are spaced too far apart. They never seem to match your waist.  THIS PROJECT HAS ENDED GET A BELT ON OUR WEBSITE  >>  KORE ESSENTIALS   But Kore belts are different. Our track system, sewn into the back of the belt, has 40+ micro size positions to adjust with - each just ¼” apart. It actually locks to your exact waist size every time you slide it on. It’s the best-fitting, most comfortable belt you will ever wear.   For the first time ever, we’re introducing 4 solid, grade 1 titanium ratchet buckles. Each buckle features a 2 millimeter thick body, with alloy undercarriage (1.5 to 2 oz. total weight). Titanium is one of the strongest, lightest metals known to man, and used to make rocket ships and supersonic jets.  These buckles do a lot more than just look good.  The Leather is Full-Grain (1-3/8 inches or 35mm wide) and chrome tanned to resist the fading and scratching you get from vegetable tanning.  Full-Grain is the highest grade of leather and actually improves with age.  Next we added a proprietary Flex-Core center for added durability and strength.  This strong, fibrous core ads strength and extends the belt life. Backers can choose between classic or pebble-grain in black or brown.  Next we added a proprietary Flex-Core center for added durability and strength.  This strong, fibrous core ads strength and extends the belt life. Backers can choose between classic or pebble-grain in black or brown. Each belt comes extra long and in One-Size that FITS ANY waist size from 24” to 44”. You trim it to your size in minutes with household scissors. Simply locate your pant size on the back of the belt using the Printed Ruler Marks (no measuring needed).  Add 4 inches and cut. Then clamp the belt into the buckle and wear. If the belt is too long, remove the buckle and cut off another inch. It's that easy. Here's your buckle and belt choices.  THIS PROJECT HAS ENDED GET A BELT ON OUR WEBSITE  >>  KORE ESSENTIALS   Now you don’t have to choose between comfort and style – you get them both. Kore Titanium Buckles and Belts are INTERCHANGEABLE with all our Kore standard fashion belts and buckles so you can mix and match. Click to Visit >> KoreEssentials <<To expedite the process, we have already begun manufacturing the items so that Backers can get their rewards sooner. We are planning to get them out 30-60 days after the project ends.  We will offer expedited worldwide service for faster delivery.  At Kore, all of our products have a 30 Money Back Guarantee if you are not happy with your purchase and 1 Year Warranty against unusual wear or any defects.                                                                 Thanks for your support ! THIS PROJECT HAS ENDED GET A BELT ON OUR WEBSITE  >>  KORE ESSENTIALS  See what a few CUSTOMERS had to say about our belts....   Here I am, a half a year later, still using the belts every day and they're still rocking. >**This campaign was setup for people who missed out on Batch 1 Wristlet Watches following the huge backer interest in the last week of our

column1:
Batch 2 watches will include Kickstarter stretch goal! $22,500

At the end of our Indiegogo campaign we'll be sending survey/email to everyone for their choice of watch strap and size. 7 Strap Variations and 2 Watch Sizes.

This is our second Indiegogo project after a successful completion and delivery of WC Sport Watches. Our exciting journey started here and we want to continue delivering some great products. As we stated in our last project we always want to be creative in our products and here's our proud new creation, The Wristlet Watch.


Vouchmag: ""A watch design that forgoes normal, and by any standard, is trend-setting from the dial to the strap to the case and leather.""

Envynde: ""The Wristlet watch is not only a great looking watch, it’s a watch that carries over 100 years of history!""

Wrist Watch Review: ""It’s definitely a distinctive look, and very likely not one you’ve actually seen on someone’s wrist.""


What is a Wristlet Watch?

A watch nestled inside the leather strap, based on the strap design from 18th Century that was used to house pocket watches.


Why Did we create it?

In the world of smart watches and high tech gadgets we wanted to bring back the old world charm and pay the tribute to the first ever wristwatch design. With this watch we are weaving the tie between the past and the present. It was a HUGH HIT in Magic Fashion Week Las Vegas.


Who is the Wristlet Watch for?

This watch is a must for a person who loves watches and for people who love leather-craftsmanship as this watch is work of art that you don't see everyday. Each leather strap goes through many technical steps that require lot of patience in order make it look how it looks finally.

Origin

The roots for this watch goes back to the first wristwatch ever created. In the last 18th and early 19th Century majority of the men used pocket watches to keep time but practicality demanded quicker way for military personnel to check watches during war times. Wristlet straps like the one shown in the picture below were invented in order to wear pocket watches on a wrist.

Wristlet Watches


New Wristlet watches are an improved and more manageable version of its predecessor from 18th Century.

WRISTLET WATCH FEATURES:  

1) QUALITY HARDWARE: Featuring Stainless Steel Case, Swiss Quartz Movement and Sapphire Crystal face.  

2) QUALITY CRAFTSMANSHIP: Handcrafted Premium Calf Leather strap with exceptional quality and contrasting white stitching.  

3) WHOLESALE PRICE: It's almost impossible to find a watch of such standard at the price we are offering.

4) OUR GUARANTEE: You'll be noticed in the crowd when you wear these watches as these our first of its kind in the world. 

5) HISTORY: Wristlet Watch has a story that's more than 100 year old and when you wear this watch you can tell that to your friends &
column2:
family and be proud of it. Not many watches can boast of having such story.

Same color stitching for the straps available.

Our Story &
column3:
Inspiration

In the 18th and 19th Century, the majority of men used pocket watches to keep time. There were some technical and social barriers that the modern wristwatches had to overcome to become essential part of every man’s wardrobe as we know today. This is true, despite the fact that, all gadgets used today have a built in clock and wristwatches are not needed to tell the time!

This is our attempt to re-create that 19th century legendary design of wrist strap (Also known then as ""Wristlet"") that was first used to house pocket watches onto the wrists for the ease of checking time during Boer War era. Below you'll see a picture of one those Wristlets and an advertisement from Mappin and Webb for one of those wristlets, Thanks to David Boettcher of vintagewatchstraps.com, who provided lot of his research for our project.


At first pocket watches were adapted by being placed in leather cups with wrist straps like the one shown in the picture. These were often called ""wristlets"" and had the benefit that a man could wear his watch on his wrist when circumstances demanded, and then return it to his pocket when fashion rather than expediency ruled.

Dr. Konrad Knirim wrote a book called 'British Military Timepieces' in which he's written lot of about Wristlet watches. Thanks to him for letting us use some pictures (from his book) of soldiers proudly sporting their Wristlet watches.

Challenge/Opportunity

Pocket watches are usually in the range of 50mm+ and as you can imagine housing a pocket watch of 50mm+ you would need a big leather cup. Along with the cup and outside seam on the leather would make the leather case diameter in the range of 55mm-60mm, which is pretty big for a wrist watch. On top of that, pocket watch ""Bow"" would always be protruding out of the strap.

Solution

In order to make a more manageable design we started by creating 2 custom watch cases, 37mm and 32mm. We built our wristlet prototypes around these cases. 37mm case makes the wristlet of around 45mm and 32mm case makes wristlet of 37mm diameter. In order to produce these cases we worked with a reliable and reputable watch case and dial manufacturer, who we’ll using for production as well.


For the straps itself, we are collaborating with a very well known company which is known for quality leather products since 1880. Leather straps for wristlets are all handmade and it’s a very labor intensive process to make them. Leather used in these wristlets is very high quality English calf leather. There were few challenges we had to overcome

column1: • Stiffening of the leather so that the cup retains its shape. This process takes more than 3 days for each strap.
• Stitching around the cup where it attaches to the wrist strap. You can notice, this stitching is very close to the cup and needs a sewing with an exceptionally narrow foot.

Design

Our case design allows not only to wear these watches in the Wristlet strap but also use them in more conventional wrist straps of 20mm and 16mm.

 



If we were to build these in small quantities, cost would be very high. In order to make this a viable product and bring down the cost of manufacturing we need to meet our manufacturer's minimum order quantity and that’s the reason we are here.

We have had a successful run on KickStarter and we are already in the process of producing our first production run. We’ve been working with manufacturers and finalizing the details. The pictures you are prototypes that have been developed in last one year. We’ve created a product we’re really excited to share with you and we hope you’ll love.
We are working with manufacturers for strap and watch inserts for our initial production run for delivery of May 2014 and second batch in June 2014.

Watch Straps will be manufactured in India by a manufacturer who's been manufacturing leather goods since 1880. They have helped us with our prototypes and have capacity to handle from small quantities to a large volume of order.

Watch Inserts will be manufactured in China by a very reputable and reliable manufacturer who manufactures watches for some very famous watch brands. We have verified the quality and their capacity to handle large volume of orders. Also, we have ensured they'll be committed to a timely delivery of our orders.

As far distribution is concerned we have partnered with multiple carriers who can deliver our products anywhere in the world. We'll be choosing appropriate carrier depending on the destination of delivery.
The next step is to get these watches on to your wrist. It's very exciting to see when your vision of a product becomes a reality. But this is where you, the backers come in to save the day.
We need your help. Your support, and yes by support We mean your money in exchange of some exciting rewards. Your support will drive where this product goes.

Our reach only goes so far beyond our networks. By simply liking or sharing us on your Facebook page, following us on twitter, or sending a few quick emails to your friends and family goes a long way. Ultimately, our hope is that you will love this watch as much as we do and pledge your support in order to receive one of the very first from us.

Money raised with your support will go directly into funding of all the required materials for our production run, packaging and shipping so we can bring these beautiful watches on to your wrists. If there are any questions, please don't hesitate to send us an email.
We have made it really easy for you share, CLICK HERE TO SHARE
We are two friends Munish Sethi and Bobby Srivastav who have founded Waves Design Studio.
We have successfully delivered our first Indiegogo project WC Sport Watches which already is a huge hit in the fashion world and is available in stores now.

Bobby is Cal State Fullerton graduate. He comes from leather industry and has over 20 years of experience in manufacturing various products. His company has been manufacturing quality leather goods since 1880. His brand name Bobby's English Tack is one of the most famous leather brand in the horse industry and is known for making quality leather products.

Munish is an Engineer. He comes from design background and have designed products for various industries including technology and fashion. Munish has over 16 years of experience in various roles including CEO and founder.

With Waves Design Studio we will will bring together our strengths/expertise in designing, manufacturing and distribution of products that are unique and innovative. We are inspired to create products that are not usual run of the mill products.

""Wristlets is one of our first product together that's inspired by history of watches. We would love to see this dream of ours become a reality, which would give people something new and different to sport on their wrists. We'll be collaborating and partnering with some reputed and reliable manufacturers to bring our creativity to a reality.""

Risks and challenges

We have spent over a year on this project already designing, prototyping, refining and testing the protypes. We wanted to make sure that the prototype is complete. We are very confident that we will deliver our products in superior quality by the projected dates.

MANUFACTURING 
We have established relationships with experienced contract manufacturers to mitigate the risk of delays by material suppliers and to ensure quality control is implemented to the highest level. While We know there will still be unexpected challenges along the way. We will always be transparent and inform our backers of potential hurdles along the way.

SHIPPING 
We have built in extra time for the manufacturing process and are confident we will ship by the projected dates. We will always keep you informed if things take longer than planned.

PRODUCTION 
We have taken the numerous steps so far to ensure that we deliver the best quality product. We have built many working prototypes with the established contract manufacturer. Extensively tested prototypes for performance and durability.
","**This campaign was setup for people who missed out on Batch 1 Wristlet Watches following the huge backer interest in the last week of our Kickstarter campaign.

Batch 2 watches will include Kickstarter stretch goal! $22,500At the end of our Indiegogo campaign we'll be sending survey/email to everyone for their choice of watch strap and size. 7 Strap Variations and 2 Watch Sizes.This is our second Indiegogo project after a successful completion and delivery of WC Sport Watches. Our exciting journey started here and we want to continue delivering some great products. As we stated in our last project we always want to be creative in our products and here's our proud new creation, The Wristlet Watch.Vouchmag: ""A watch design that forgoes normal, and by any standard, is trend-setting from the dial to the strap to the case and leather.""Envynde: ""The Wristlet watch is not only a great looking watch, it’s a watch that carries over 100 years of history!""Wrist Watch Review: ""It’s definitely a distinctive look, and very likely not one you’ve actually seen on someone’s wrist.""What is a Wristlet Watch?A watch nestled inside the leather strap, based on the strap design from 18th Century that was used to house pocket watches.Why Did we create it?In the world of smart watches and high tech gadgets we wanted to bring back the old world charm and pay the tribute to the first ever wristwatch design. With this watch we are weaving the tie between the past and the present. It was a HUGH HIT in Magic Fashion Week Las Vegas.Who is the Wristlet Watch for?This watch is a must for a person who loves watches and for people who love leather-craftsmanship as this watch is work of art that you don't see everyday. Each leather strap goes through many technical steps that require lot of patience in order make it look how it looks finally.OriginThe roots for this watch goes back to the first wristwatch ever created. In the last 18th and early 19th Century majority of the men used pocket watches to keep time but practicality demanded quicker way for military personnel to check watches during war times. Wristlet straps like the one shown in the picture below were invented in order to wear pocket watches on a wrist.Wristlet WatchesNew Wristlet watches are an improved and more manageable version of its predecessor from 18th Century.WRISTLET WATCH FEATURES:  1) QUALITY HARDWARE: Featuring Stainless Steel Case, Swiss Quartz Movement and Sapphire Crystal face.  2) QUALITY CRAFTSMANSHIP: Handcrafted Premium Calf Leather strap with exceptional quality and contrasting white stitching.  3) WHOLESALE PRICE: It's almost impossible to find a watch of such standard at the price we are offering.4) OUR GUARANTEE: You'll be noticed in the crowd when you wear these watches as these our first of its kind in the world. 5) HISTORY: Wristlet Watch has a story that's more than 100 year old and when you wear this watch you can tell that to your friends & family and be proud of it. Not many watches can boast of having such story.Same color stitching for the straps available.Our Story & InspirationIn the 18th and 19th Century, the majority of men used pocket watches to keep time. There were some technical and social barriers that the modern wristwatches had to overcome to become essential part of every man’s wardrobe as we know today. This is true, despite the fact that, all gadgets used today have a built in clock and wristwatches are not needed to tell the time!This is our attempt to re-create that 19th century legendary design of wrist strap (Also known then as ""Wristlet"") that was first used to house pocket watches onto the wrists for the ease of checking time during Boer War era. Below you'll see a picture of one those Wristlets and an advertisement from Mappin and Webb for one of those wristlets, Thanks to David Boettcher of vintagewatchstraps.com, who provided lot of his research for our project.At first pocket watches were adapted by being placed in leather cups with wrist straps like the one shown in the picture. These were often called ""wristlets"" and had the benefit that a man could wear his watch on his wrist when circumstances demanded, and then return it to his pocket when fashion rather than expediency ruled.Dr. Konrad Knirim wrote a book called 'British Military Timepieces' in which he's written lot of about Wristlet watches. Thanks to him for letting us use some pictures (from his book) of soldiers proudly sporting their Wristlet watches.Challenge/OpportunityPocket watches are usually in the range of 50mm+ and as you can imagine housing a pocket watch of 50mm+ you would need a big leather cup. Along with the cup and outside seam on the leather would make the leather case diameter in the range of 55mm-60mm, which is pretty big for a wrist watch. On top of that, pocket watch ""Bow"" would always be protruding out of the strap.SolutionIn order to make a more manageable design we started by creating 2 custom watch cases, 37mm and 32mm. We built our wristlet prototypes around these cases. 37mm case makes the wristlet of around 45mm and 32mm case makes wristlet of 37mm diameter. In order to produce these cases we worked with a reliable and reputable watch case and dial manufacturer, who we’ll using for production as well.For the straps itself, we are collaborating with a very well known company which is known for quality leather products since 1880. Leather straps for wristlets are all handmade and it’s a very labor intensive process to make them. Leather used in these wristlets is very high quality English calf leather. There were few challenges we had to overcome
Stiffening of the leather so that the cup retains its shape. This process takes more than 3 days for each strap.
Stitching around the cup where it attaches to the wrist strap. You can notice, this stitching is very close to the cup and needs a sewing with an exceptionally narrow foot.

DesignOur case design allows not only to wear these watches in the Wristlet strap but also use them in more conventional wrist straps of 20mm and 16mm. If we were to build these in small quantities, cost would be very high. In order to make this a viable product and bring down the cost of manufacturing we need to meet our manufacturer's minimum order quantity and that’s the reason we are here.
Where we are now & Where are we heading?

We have had a successful run on KickStarter and we are already in the process of producing our first production run. We’ve been working with manufacturers and finalizing the details. The pictures you are prototypes that have been developed in last one year. We’ve created a product we’re really excited to share with you and we hope you’ll love.
We are working with manufacturers for strap and watch inserts for our initial production run for delivery of May 2014 and second batch in June 2014.

Watch Straps will be manufactured in India by a manufacturer who's been manufacturing leather goods since 1880. They have helped us with our prototypes and have capacity to handle from small quantities to a large volume of order.

Watch Inserts will be manufactured in China by a very reputable and reliable manufacturer who manufactures watches for some very famous watch brands. We have verified the quality and their capacity to handle large volume of orders. Also, we have ensured they'll be committed to a timely delivery of our orders.

As far distribution is concerned we have partnered with multiple carriers who can deliver our products anywhere in the world. We'll be choosing appropriate carrier depending on the destination of delivery.
The next step is to get these watches on to your wrist. It's very exciting to see when your vision of a product becomes a reality. But this is where you, the backers come in to save the day.
We need your help. Your support, and yes by support We mean your money in exchange of some exciting rewards. Your support will drive where this product goes.

Our reach only goes so far beyond our networks. By simply liking or sharing us on your Facebook page, following us on twitter, or sending a few quick emails to your friends and family goes a long way. Ultimately, our hope is that you will love this watch as much as we do and pledge your support in order to receive one of the very first from us.

Money raised with your support will go directly into funding of all the required materials for our production run, packaging and shipping so we can bring these beautiful watches on to your wrists. If there are any questions, please don't hesitate to send us an email.

column4: >""Glow* is a place of encouragement, resource, and community.

column1:
A sanctuary where girls and women can connect  with one another.  It is a collective opportunity to inspire ourselves and others. 

A place where the challenges of the past and present can and will be overthrown by the opportunities of the future. 

Glow* intends to share inspiring stories, research, and testimonies, and to organize events and gatherings where women have the chance to step up into their greatest selves, and begin writing their own stories. 

You can’t be what you can’t see, so it’s time for women everywhere to get up and Glow*.""

knowyourglow.com

Let it glow*, let it glow*, can't hold us back anymore...  

When setting up this campaign, our whole team decided to be brutally honest with all interested parties when it came to money. We have set our goal as the highest amount we will need to make this event a reality. 

This is truley one of those cases where every pound that people are willing to give is will make a difference. 

Without the funding this event will not happen. But we do not want to think like that, because we honestly believe we can do this. 

This will not be our only fundraising attempt, but it is the one we must rely on to get us at least half of the way. 

Thank you, 

The Let's Glow* Britain team

Emily L, Beth, Emily M, and Becky

Introducing the Breton Weekender!

Keeping true to our brand, we designed the Breton Weekender to travel comfortably and organize all of your gear, while still looking like a high-end bag. The Breton Weekender is a modern travel bag, combining the vintage look of waxed cotton and the premium feel of Italian leather. Perfect for your next weekend getaway.
column8: >
column14: >The Perfect Companion to the Modern Day Briefcase
column19:
s=b803ea359e29b760edb5c3472fdea285"" src="""" style=""""/>

 

Weekender Features

The Breton Weekender was designed to look and feel like the Modern Day Briefcase. Like the Modern Day Briefcase, the Weekender comes in three different colors: blue, black, and grey. This bag is designed with Italian leather handles, an adjustable leather shoulder strap, a padded laptop sleeve, and 10 additional pockets to store everything you need for your next trip.

column15:
'/>

Materials

To make sure that the Weekender will get better with age, we started with the best materials.

We source our leather from La Bretagna, one of the oldest tanneries in Italy. This leather is rich and durable, and will gain character with each additional use.

For the exterior of the bag, we chose a 10 oz. waxed cotton to make the bag water-resistant and durable. In addition, we used the most reliable YKK zippers on the market to ensure the bag's reliability.

Design

Past Project

column54:
s=2bee61ff7728d6765c8dd199af374b6f"" src="""" style=""""/>

About Me

I am a recovering attorney who has worked for enough people to last a lifetime. After realizing how much I disliked attorney life, I worked for a startup as the director of operations for awhile, before I decided to risk it all, and become an entrepreneur full-time.

This company was jump-started by Mark Cuban. Really, no joke! When I was considering whether or not to start working on this bag, I came across the following quote by Mark Cuban:

""[E]very entrepreneur's job is to invent the future. I also call it ‘kicking your own [butt].” Someone is out there who thinks they have a better idea than you have. A better solution than you have. A better or more efficient product than you have...it's part of your job as the owner of the company to stay ahead of them.""

After reading this quote, I decided I was not going to be the guy who stood on the sidelines saying, “I came up with that idea first, but I was too busy.” From that day on, I started waking up at 4 am, so that I could work on the project for three hours before I went to work. Now two years later, after funding our first project, we are launching our second bag on Kickstarter.

I have a bunch of kids (4) and a beautiful wife who keeps me on my toes. If I'm not in the office, I'm probably road biking.

Thank you

Thank you to all of my friends, family, and backers who have supported and encouraged me throughout this whole process. I could not have done this without you! I would especially like to thank my wife who has supported and encouraged me along the way. Also, I would like to thank the following people who have helped me throughout my campaign:

Industrial and Graphic Design: Samuel Whitworth

Video: Big Door Network

Photography: Weston Colton &

Jorge Tenorio

Cheerleader Squad: Jacob Carter &

column1: I have firsthand, professional experience with product development and manufacturing. In preparation for this campaign, I have already setup partnerships with skilled tradesmen for materials and manufacturing. I want to make sure I avoid any potential risks and delays in delivering the Breton Weekender.

With that said, there are inherent risks of delay during the production process that may be beyond my control. In any case, I will keep backers updated throughout the campaign and manufacturing phase to ensure that I stay as true as possible to the proposed delivery schedule.
Thank you for joining my story and helping make the Breton Weekender a reality!

Short Summary

Okay... so... (*phew*)... this is hard for me.  I'm trying to channel Amanda Palmer and just *ASK*... but asking is excruciatingly hard for me...
I have a lot to offer the world.  I'm an artist, musician, blogger and storyteller - but - more than that... I have:

column3: > transformed my life, my body, my career, my lifestyle and the way I educate my kids... (and I want to share that journey with others and offer encouragement, advice and inspiration)...

column2: >And I have a fairly successful blog... with a couple-thousand visitors per month...
>And I have written an illustrated book titled ""How Heather got her HAT'ness back"" (soon to be self-published and shared with the world)...

column3: self-discovery workshops for women and girls (like this one)...

column2: >And I host concerts and story-telling evenings... and I write music and sing songs...
>And I've launched this humanitarian project (with support from people like Vivienne Westwood)... and
column3: list=UUijSzeK80Ur9enthy3-IaOw"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">this youth development project (with corporate sponsorship)... and this NGO... (and hooooo-boy.... the LESSONS I have learned and the STORIES I could tell you about *those* experiences!!!)... (including what it feels like to burn-out from trying to help everyone else at the expense of one's own dreams)...

column1: • And I've travelled extensively,  been nominated as a Tearfund ""Inspired Individual"",  won a Diamond-in-the-Rough award and was invited to Nashville by a producer to record a demo (which I did), spoken (and sung) at various events around the world,  been interviewed on various radio &
column2: TV shows (both in South Africa and abroad), was chosen as one of 10 social entrepreneurs from around the world to speak at the City Hall during Design Indaba... (the list of stuff and stories could go on)...

column1: And yet... in spite of all these incredible experiences and opportunities... and all of my abilities...
I have $3.50 in my paypal account.  And about $6.50 in my personal bank account.
Because - although I am VERY GOOD at what I do... (all the creative stuff, that is)...

And I suck at strategising... sales... business-planning... and neatly project-managing all of my zillions of creative ideas in a coherent way which *could* earn me a decent income... (but doesn't.  And hasn't.  For a long, long time).
It's embarrassing.  And - I'm embarrassed to even share this story with you.

Thankfully - I have a very supportive husband (who is currently the sole breadwinner)... and we are careful with our spending and we have drastically reduced our debt... but I am frustrated with myself because I *know* I can contribute something of value to the world AND earn myself an income at the same time... and I know I *could* contribute financially to our family (and ease the load on Nick)... but it's like all the little itty-bitty pieces and zillions of ideas are floating all over the place and I really struggle to bring it all together... in strategic, coherent manner.

column2:
What You Get

Enter Marie Forleo's B-School

column1: Tracy still needs a cohesive, strategic business plan to work from.  And B-School can help us put it all together!

$2000 - or rather, $1999 to be precise.  What's more - registration closes on the 4th of March... and B-school only happens once a year (so I've sorta got a little fire lit under my bum at the moment)...
If you DO decide to support me on this quest... and send me through B-school... I'll post you all kinds of happy-Hat art-offerings (just check out the ""perks"" on the right)...
I just know that B-school is going to help me gain CLARITY and a cohesive, step-by-step plan of action.   I know that it will help me to better answer the following questions:

column2: >Who am I trying to help and serve?
>How do I keep people interested in my books and projects without drowning them in boring promotional material?
>Should Living Differently be somehow combined with Beautiful Life Project?
>How do I effectively combine all my pet-projects with the least possible confusion (to the people who follow those different projects).?
>How do I market my creative workshops?

column1: • What should come first:  ""SHINE! Camp for Girls"" or the creative workshops designed to help folk of all ages to discover and embrace their uniqueness...?

column2: >Which of my courses will be MOST helpful to my audience?
>Which of my courses are irrelevant and should be ditched?
>Should I offer online courses - and if so, how much content should I include?
>How much should I charge for those online courses?
>How do I make a decent living (for Tracy and myself)... whilst still offering lots of free, fun material for my wonderful online tribe?
>How do I sell myself (and my products)... without making my tribe feel used and abused?
>How do I answer the dreaded dinner-party question:  ""So... what do YOU do?""

column1: (And many, many other questions that I really struggle to answer in a cohesive manner).

And if we don't raise enough money... (or raise MORE than the $2000 goal)...?

If we don't raise the full $2000... I will use whatever we *have* raised to get myself into B-school (Marie offers a 4-month payment plan of $549)... and I'll have to think of some creative ways to come up with the balance.
If we raise *more* than the $2000... the rest of the money will be invested in to the following:
• Printing lots of copies of ""How Heather got her HAT'ness back""...
<li>Promo material, food and musicians for the launch (of above-mentioned book) which will include an evening of Songs &amp
• Anything else will go towards producing the course material... the short film... and all kinds of other big-dreams and stuff...
(Basically saying... I'm not gonna blow the money on shoes.  Or Nutella).

As I mentioned, this is hard.  Asking is really hard for me.  Deep down inside of me (and I'm pretty sure that every artist struggles with this on some level)... there's an angry little voice screaming:
""Stop begging, you loser!""  and  ""Get a REAL job!""

I suspect there's still some dodgy remnants from all those years ago when I first ""lost"" Hat (for those of you who have no cooking clue of what I'm talking about when I talk about ""Hat"" - just click here).

Anyhoo... I remember something Amanda Palmer said (after she had raised all that money on Kickstarter) and the press were saying:  ""Amanda - how did you make all those people support your campaign?"" - and she said:

So... this is me... *asking*... :  Can you help enrol me in B-school?  Can you help me print some Hatbooks?  Can you help?

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any funds to spare... I'd still appreciate your support spreading the word - or simply connecting with me.   Any words of advice or encouragement are always enormously appreciated (I'm a words-of-affirmation love-language person).
","Short Summary Okay... so... (*phew*)... this is hard for me.  I'm trying to channel Amanda Palmer and just *ASK*... but asking is excruciatingly hard for me...
I have a lot to offer the world.  I'm an artist, musician, blogger and storyteller - but - more than that... I have:
Completely transformed my life, my body, my career, my lifestyle and the way I educate my kids... (and I want to share that journey with others and offer encouragement, advice and inspiration)...
And I have a fairly successful blog... with a couple-thousand visitors per month...
And I have written an illustrated book titled ""How Heather got her HAT'ness back"" (soon to be self-published and shared with the world)...
And I have hosted creative self-esteem & self-discovery workshops for women and girls (like this one)...
And I host concerts and story-telling evenings... and I write music and sing songs...

And I've launched this humanitarian project (with support from people like Vivienne Westwood)... and this youth development project (with corporate sponsorship)... and this NGO... (and hooooo-boy.... the LESSONS I have learned and the STORIES I could tell you about *those* experiences!!!)... (including what it feels like to burn-out from trying to help everyone else at the expense of one's own dreams)...

And I've travelled extensively,  been nominated as a Tearfund ""Inspired Individual"",  won a Diamond-in-the-Rough award and was invited to Nashville by a producer to record a demo (which I did), spoken (and sung) at various events around the world,  been interviewed on various radio & TV shows (both in South Africa and abroad), was chosen as one of 10 social entrepreneurs from around the world to speak at the City Hall during Design Indaba... (the list of stuff and stories could go on)...
And yet... in spite of all these incredible experiences and opportunities... and all of my abilities...
I have $3.50 in my paypal account.  And about $6.50 in my personal bank account.
Because - although I am VERY GOOD at what I do... (all the creative stuff, that is)...
I utterly suck at marketing myself.

And I suck at strategising... sales... business-planning... and neatly project-managing all of my zillions of creative ideas in a coherent way which *could* earn me a decent income... (but doesn't.  And hasn't.  For a long, long time).
It's embarrassing.  And - I'm embarrassed to even share this story with you.

Thankfully - I have a very supportive husband (who is currently the sole breadwinner)... and we are careful with our spending and we have drastically reduced our debt... but I am frustrated with myself because I *know* I can contribute something of value to the world AND earn myself an income at the same time... and I know I *could* contribute financially to our family (and ease the load on Nick)... but it's like all the little itty-bitty pieces and zillions of ideas are floating all over the place and I really struggle to bring it all together... in strategic, coherent manner.
What I Need & What You Get Enter Marie Forleo's B-School.

Well, in Marie's words:  'B-School is an 8 week online training program that shows you step-by-step how to build a unique and profitable brand, market more effectively, and turn your online presence into a world-changing machine"".
I need B-school!  In fact - I wanted to sign up for B-school last year (but didn't have the money and was too embarrassed to ask anyone for help).

I desperately need those step-by-step strategies (because my brain just doesn't think like that!)... My brain doesn't do ""step-by-step""... my brain doesn't do ""strategic plan-of-action""... my brain thinks in bright colours and stories and images and endless streams of creative ideas!

I really-really-really think that B-school can help me cohesively organise my business (and I'm especially convinced after I read through the curriculum offered... and then read about all the B-school grads - many of whom are creative creatures like me!  :-) )

And even better news... after writing a blog post on how I needed help and was searching for my ""Andrew"" (a business partner - polar-opposite in strengths to me)... I now have wonderful-Tracy (helping me on a part-time basis).

Tracy is opposite to me (strengths wise).  She's brilliant with admin, budgeting, counting, organising and implementing - and she's great at holding me accountable... but even Tracy can't read my crazy-creative brain!
Tracy still needs a cohesive, strategic business plan to work from.  And B-School can help us put it all together!

$2000 - or rather, $1999 to be precise.  What's more - registration closes on the 4th of March... and B-school only happens once a year (so I've sorta got a little fire lit under my bum at the moment)...
If you DO decide to support me on this quest... and send me through B-school... I'll post you all kinds of happy-Hat art-offerings (just check out the ""perks"" on the right)...
I just know that B-school is going to help me gain CLARITY and a cohesive, step-by-step plan of action.   I know that it will help me to better answer the following questions:
Who am I trying to help and serve?
How do I keep people interested in my books and projects without drowning them in boring promotional material?
Should Living Differently be somehow combined with Beautiful Life Project?
How do I effectively combine all my pet-projects with the least possible confusion (to the people who follow those different projects).?
How do I market my creative workshops?
What should come first:  ""SHINE! Camp for Girls"" or the creative workshops designed to help folk of all ages to discover and embrace their uniqueness...?
Which of my courses will be MOST helpful to my audience?
Which of my courses are irrelevant and should be ditched?
Should I offer online courses - and if so, how much content should I include?
How much should I charge for those online courses?
How do I make a decent living (for Tracy and myself)... whilst still offering lots of free, fun material for my wonderful online tribe?
How do I sell myself (and my products)... without making my tribe feel used and abused?
How do I answer the dreaded dinner-party question:  ""So... what do YOU do?""
(And many, many other questions that I really struggle to answer in a cohesive manner).

And if we don't raise enough money... (or raise MORE than the $2000 goal)...?If we don't raise the full $2000... I will use whatever we *have* raised to get myself into B-school (Marie offers a 4-month payment plan of $549)... and I'll have to think of some creative ways to come up with the balance.
If we raise *more* than the $2000... the rest of the money will be invested in to the following:
Printing lots of copies of ""How Heather got her HAT'ness back""...
Promo material, food and musicians for the launch (of above-mentioned book) which will include an evening of Songs & Stories... :-)
Anything else will go towards producing the course material... the short film... and all kinds of other big-dreams and stuff...
(Basically saying... I'm not gonna blow the money on shoes.  Or Nutella).

As I mentioned, this is hard.  Asking is really hard for me.  Deep down inside of me (and I'm pretty sure that every artist struggles with this on some level)... there's an angry little voice screaming:
Stop begging, you loser!""  and  ""Get a REAL job!""

I suspect there's still some dodgy remnants from all those years ago when I first ""lost"" Hat (for those of you who have no cooking clue of what I'm talking about when I talk about ""Hat"" - just click here).

Anyhoo... I remember something Amanda Palmer said (after she had raised all that money on Kickstarter) and the press were saying:  ""Amanda - how did you make all those people support your campaign?"" - and she said:
I didn't make them.  I asked them"".

So... this is me... *asking*... :  Can you help enrol me in B-school?  Can you help me print some Hatbooks?  Can you help?   Other Ways You Can Help If you don't have any funds to spare... I'd still appreciate your support spreading the word - or simply connecting with me.   Any words of advice or encouragement are always enormously appreciated (I'm a words-of-affirmation love-language person).

An INNOVATIVE WAY to keep your most treasure and valuable pieces completely KINK and TANGLE free.

The Story: Where do i start? Kinkless has been a labor of love. A few years ago, I had a dream where the idea of Kinkless came to me. I remember growing up in the 80s and 90s where wearing gold and silver necklaces were a FAD but often, especially as children, they would become tangled. It would be such a frustrating process to untangle them. Many big chain jewelry store sell the service to untangle them but more often than not, with the big ""we buy gold franchise"", you'll notice that a lot of people just sell their pieces. But it's it important to keep them and pass it on. There's a reason you see stays like Beyonce, Rihanna and Drake, covered in gold items in their videos, on vacation. It's a sign of wealth and as the price of gold and silver rises and the barrier to purchase increases, it's never been more important to pass on those precious metals as heirlooms and I truly believe my product will allow you to do just. My hope is when you purchase an item, it will come in a Kinkless to help you keep it perfect from day one.

column2: >
column3:
> 

Remember the days when everyone wore gold and silver necklaces, bracelets or jewelry pieces. Remember, the thinner the piece the more likely it was to get tangled. Well, what if you bought a piece and it was packaged in such a way it would never get tangled. That’s the idea behind Kinkless.
column9:
>I have spent the last year planning, working with suppliers and prototyping Kinkless. I am happy to bring this piece to you. I need your support in order to meet my minimum production mark of $15,000. By raising at least $15,000, I will be able to scale up our production to market level and thus order certain quantities at lower prices.  

Funding Kinkless will also allow me to develop the Kinkless roll.
column10:
> 

Thank you for supporting Kinkless.

Fashion Comes To Light:  is an inspired, visually compelling LIVE Wearable Art Installation, highlighted by light components. Fashion Comes To Light features innovative wearable concepts created by Baltimore area clothing designers
column2: light, canvas and living fiber artists.

column1: Through collaboration and integration of multiple artistic disciplines, our collective of designers, artists, hair stylists and make-up artists will create a seamless, textured ambience.  Our designers will present innovative, visionary conceptual wearables and embellishments.

The Fashion Comes To Light Collaborative looks forward to introducing Neo-Haute Couture, a fashion aesthetic category where technology meets traditional and non-traditional textiles, design techniques, live and edible embellishment.

Participating Fashion Comes To Light Clothing and Accessory Designers will be tasked with creating one to two garments and accessories incorporating light components, such as LED, berry lights, glass, mirrors, images projected onto the fabric, black light, or any combination of these elements.   One or more of these garments shall be avant-garde in design, the other(s) mainstream wearable, retail ready.  These garments will be constructed from traditional fabric, non-traditional fibers, and recycled materials, including integrated use of: scrap fabric, old garments, remnants, plastic, bubble wrap, burlap, muslin, netting and other repurposed materials.
The garments and accessories chosen for presentation during the Fashion Comes to Light showcase will be available for sale in select Baltimore area boutiques during the 2017 Spring/Summer season.

We’ve been awarded $2000.00 from the Baltimore Office of Promotion and the Arts to participate in Light City Baltimore 2017. A donation in any amount will assist us in reaching our goal of $3000.00 to underwrite honorariums for participating talent and production costs.

This is a golden opportunity for working artists creating in a variety of mediums, genres and disciplines to be acknowledged, gain collaborative experience, enhance their revenue generating potential, and promote sales of their visionary designs at the local and regional level
column2: and the national and international marketplace.

column1:
0,"

The Tersus

Tersus – Latin for clean, neat, pure, correct. This exemplifies exactly the look and character of our next collection. Clean lines, neat styling, pure concept, correct timekeeping. The appeal of the watch is in the simplicity, it’s all about removing the trees and seeing the wood, suspending the gadgets and revealing the clarity and effortless style of an immaculate timepiece. No clutter, no confusion. 

For men and women, for all occasions and lifestyle. Wear every day and any day made possible by the choice of 40mm for the larger wrist or 36mm for the smaller wrist, with stainless steel silver or gold cases and a choice of eight straps (for now - more to come) in soft supple leather or NATO. A great selection to match your own mood and individuality.  

 WHYTES PRIMARY GOALS

1. Quality – Our primary goal for all watches we manufacture. Quality is the mainstay of our philosophy which means not only the watch but also the packaging, shipping and customer service.

2. Price – We painstakingly source the best component parts, but that does not mean a high price tag. Our profit margin is low to provide direct sales to you on Kickstarter whilst allowing us sufficient funds to develop the next watch. It is a formula that works and which we will stick to. Exorbitant prices are not necessary to be able to produce an excellent watch. We have proved that.

 3. Design – We want the watch to look beautiful. Take a look at our pictures
column2:
we think they look stunning. Minimal fuss, maximum impact. Fine craftsmanship need not be loud, quiet, refined and understated speaks for itself. 

4. Manufacture – Our ultimate goal is to bring as much of the manufacturing process as possible into Canada. We want our future production to be fully completed in beautiful British Columbia, bringing more work to the region and ensuring our other goals are achieved.  

Premium components come as standard with the TERSUS

A slim polished 316LStainless Steel case with built in strength and integrity lies flat to the wrist, surgical instrument quality, unobtrusive and beautiful.

SWISS Ronda quartz movement, extremely reliable and highly praised for its accuracy and precision and made by one of the most reputable movement manufacturers in the world.

Sapphire crystal glass which only a diamond can scratch. There is no point in building a great watch then only using mineral glass that will not protect the dial. Our sapphire crystal will never crack, scratch or mark. All this and with an Anti-Reflective coating so that the dial is always visible even when the lights are bright.

Raised indices with a classic blend of markers and numbers add a little interest to the mix. 

An unobtrusive crown, a shaped back case and angled lugs aid the comfort factor and the overall slimness of the watch. 

Functional and easy to read ceramic dial with date window. 

Excellent Prices

Quality timepieces without the hefty price tag gives everyone the ability to invest in a watch that will stand the test of time. No middle man, just honest and transparent prices. 

 We listen

Through talking to our customers we learned what you wanted to see in a watch. What came out on top was simplicity of design, accuracy of movement, and a choice of good quality straps in leather and NATO. We listened and the Tersus was born.

Keeping you informed

We have also learned the importance of keeping our backers appraised of the situation continually throughout the process from end of campaign through to receipt of the watch, and the satisfactory resolution of any issues that may arise. We pride ourselves on excellent customer service and business transparency and we guarantee that you will receive your watch to the expected high standard, in a timely manner, packaged well and with fantastic after sales service.

Cases and Straps

Cases: 40mm or 36mm each available in silver or gold

Straps: Leather or Nato in a range of colours

Our Italian leather straps are soft, supple and slightly padded and will gain a delectable patina with age and wear. The NATO straps are made from strong stain resistant Nylon and made with a huge variety of colours. Both leather and NATO come with stainless steel fittings. Above you can see the initial choice of straps, more will follow.

Movement

A fine watch deserves an equally fine movement, We have been to Switzerland where the most prestigious and coveted movements are made and we selected Ronda to be the heart of the watch. Swiss movements are prized for their dependability and accuracy and the Ronda company is world renowned for their innovative and precision designs.

Watch Specifications:

Case: either 40mm or 36mm Stainless Steel 

Watch depth: 7mm

Band: Choice of NATO or Leather (chosen at project end) 

Band Width: 20 mm for 40mm watch and 16mm for 36mm watch

Case Material: Stainless Steel 316L in Gold or Silver  

Back: Stainless Steel 316L 

Clasp Material: Stainless Steel 316L 

Dial Window Material: Sapphire Crystal Glass with Anti-Reflective  coating 

Movement: Swiss Ronda Quartz 

Date Function: Yes 

Seconds Function: Yes 

Water Resistant: 5 ATM 

Battery: Sony SR621SW, four year battery life.

Warranty  

We are very confident with the superb quality of the Tersus, so much so that we are giving a 5 year warranty on anything that goes on inside the watch i.e the movement, hands, face that malfunctions as a result of a manufacturing fault. Not many companies have that level of confidence.

Our Business

We have learned a lot from our last Kickstarter campaign, especially regarding the relationship you must have with your manufacturer. We have developed a tight partnership with ours and we are confident that they can produce and deliver a top quality watch in keeping with our own high standards, due to their sophisticated manufacturing process and shared passion. They are experienced and produce for several high quality retail brands, however we have a personal relationship and they are flexible and able to cater to our particular needs. Quality is as important to them as it is to us and they employ rigorous quality control measures. Additionally, as we cannot be there to oversee the entire process, as an added control measure we also employ at key points in the process an independent quality control expert to ensure our high standards are being continually met. Once we receive the watches they undergo further rigorous tests and further quality checks so that we are absolutely confident they will reach you in pristine condition.

Timeline

After the Kickstarter campaign has ended we will send out surveys to our backers to gather information necessary for us to begin production. We will be managing watch manufacture, packaging, postage and customs concerns and personally ensuring that outgoing shipping happens as soon as possible. We will do our utmost to mitigate against delays and keep our backers updated regularly at every point along the journey.

With thanks to our videographers, photographers and models at Bocajj

Our Whytes Tersus video was filmed and photographs taken on a rainy, blustery October day in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.
column3:
> WHYTES WATCHES - TAKE YOUR TIME

Risks and challenges

Our Risks are reduced due to our previous experience in producing a watch for our supporters on Kickstarter previously but they still exist.

Our risks and challenges are the same as others with product-based Kickstarter campaigns – typically this is production delays. With the selection of our suppliers complete and test dates tested and achieved we do not anticipate delays beyond our timeline
column4:
however, there are no guarantees in life and so it is possible that something unanticipated could occur during production.

If something were to happen, rest assured that we would keep our Kickstarter community appraised of the situation.

Swiss movements are prized for their dependability and accuracy and the Ronda company is world renowned for their innovative and precision designs.Watch Specifications:Case: either 40mm or 36mm Stainless Steel Watch depth: 7mmBand: Choice of NATO or Leather (chosen at project end) Band Width: 20 mm for 40mm watch and 16mm for 36mm watchCase Material: Stainless Steel 316L in Gold or Silver  Back: Stainless Steel 316L Clasp Material: Stainless Steel 316L Dial Window Material: Sapphire Crystal Glass with Anti-Reflective  coating Movement: Swiss Ronda Quartz Date Function: Yes Seconds Function: Yes Water Resistant: 5 ATM Battery: Sony SR621SW, four year battery life.Warranty  We are very confident with the superb quality of the Tersus, so much so that we are giving a 5 year warranty on anything that goes on inside the watch i.e the movement, hands, face that malfunctions as a result of a manufacturing fault. Not many companies have that level of confidence.Our BusinessWe have learned a lot from our last Kickstarter campaign, especially regarding the relationship you must have with your manufacturer. We have developed a tight partnership with ours and we are confident that they can produce and deliver a top quality watch in keeping with our own high standards, due to their sophisticated manufacturing process and shared passion. They are experienced and produce for several high quality retail brands, however we have a personal relationship and they are flexible and able to cater to our particular needs. Quality is as important to them as it is to us and they employ rigorous quality control measures. Additionally, as we cannot be there to oversee the entire process, as an added control measure we also employ at key points in the process an independent quality control expert to ensure our high standards are being continually met. Once we receive the watches they undergo further rigorous tests and further quality checks so that we are absolutely confident they will reach you in pristine condition.TimelineAfter the Kickstarter campaign has ended we will send out surveys to our backers to gather information necessary for us to begin production. We will be managing watch manufacture, packaging, postage and customs concerns and personally ensuring that outgoing shipping happens as soon as possible. We will do our utmost to mitigate against delays and keep our backers updated regularly at every point along the journey.With thanks to our videographers, photographers and models at BocajjOur Whytes Tersus video was filmed and photographs taken on a rainy, blustery October day in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. WHYTES WATCHES - TAKE YOUR TIMERisks and challengesOur Risks are reduced due to our previous experience in producing a watch for our supporters on Kickstarter previously but they still exist.Our risks and challenges are the same as others with product-based Kickstarter campaigns – typically this is production delays. With the selection of our suppliers complete and test dates tested and achieved we do not anticipate delays beyond our timeline
column6: however, there are no guarantees in life and so it is possible that something unanticipated could occur during production.If something were to happen, rest assured that we would keep our Kickstarter community appraised of the situation.",13.0,0,"2 Campaigns

0,"

The Whoa Board is versatile, and can be used for a wide variety of applications. In addition to adding touch sensitivity to EL materials, it can also perform much in the same way as an Arduino Leonardo, outputting MIDI, using radios to communicate wirelessly.

 

It works with any EL material, including things like, including things like ""chasing wire"".

 

What are EL materials?

 

 

These different materials can be integrated into things like bike jackets (that the Whoa Board can trigger in response to motion).

 

Or masks for performance (design by iLuminate).

 

The Whoa Board's patent pending LumiSense technology for the first time makes it possible to turn any of them into a sensor.

This makes it easy to integrate interactive elements into designs that previously could have only been realized by complex and bulky systems.

 

Wait, what? How!

The Whoa board has dedicated circuitry which makes it possible to perform measurements while EL materials are glowing. All that you need to get started is the board, a micro-usb cable, and a piece of EL.

No Programming Required!

 

 

However it is also a fully featured (open source and arduino compatible) prototyping platform optimized for wearable electronics. Follow the development effort with our github repo!

It has a number of programmable hardware pins that can be used for everything from communicating with wireless modules, to listening to a microphone. In particular speaks the following serial protocols: UART, SPI, and I2C.

It turns EL elements into capacitive sensing elements, a similar technique to cell phone screens. This means that it can measure presence at a distance.

 

When EL elements are integrated into clothes, these measurements are sensitive enough to detect movement.

 

The Whoa Board is a totally new design tool!

It makes it possible to translate ideas from VR into the headset-less world (Poi by Asmara Vega).

More than that, it radically expands the design possibilities for smart clothes, and we are really excited to see what the community will produce!

Additionally, as we explore new applications of this technology together, we would like to facilitate a conversation which leads us to discover ways to manufacture these new garments sustainability. To this end, we have partnered with the Tripty Project to source fabrics for our higher level rewards.

This article provides a good jumping off point thinking about the current ecological impact of the fashion industry.

What are we and what do we want? / Hvem er vi og hva vil vi?

 

Wørld Widæ Clothing is a company who wants too represent the young spirits and their modern lifestyles. In today's societies there is a lot of focus on traveling and the world coming together as one. With this company we wish to present designs and concepts that are spoken internationally. But, also breaking language and cultures barriers all over the world. We wish to reach the world travelers with our streetwear. 

Our clothing and product designs are inspired by Korean streetwear.  Which is known for it's unique apperance. We want our costumers to express their creativity and inner spirit through our clothing. 

 

https://www.instagram.com/worldwidaeclothing/

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Wørld Widæ Cothing er et selskap som ønsker å representere den free-spirited generasjonen og dems moderne livsstil. I dagens samfunn er det stort fokus på reising og bringe verden sammen som en helhet. Med dette selskapet ønsker vi å presentere design og konsepter som kommuniserer på tvers av landegrenser, uavhengig av språk og kulturell bakgrunn. 
Vi ønsker å nå generasjonen som elsker å reise.

Våre klær og design er inspirert av koreansk moderne streetstyle, som er kjent for sitt unike utseende. Vi ønsker at våre brukere skal få uttrykke sin kreativitet og personlighet igjennom våre produkter.

https://www.instagram.com/worldwidaeclothing/

 

Who are we?

Marina

My name is Marina and i am 25 years old and the founder of Wørld Widæ Clothing.
I grew up traveling and seeing different cultures being born in Bosnia &
column2:
Herzegovina  and growing up in Norway.
In High School I majored Media &
column3:
Communication and then moved on to a bachelor degree in Music Business in College. Part of this degree took place in Los Angeles a city I deeply fell in love with. I started getting in to Korean cuture way before this, I believe it's 7 years ago now. Being facinated by the Music industry and the fashion scene in Korea I decided to move to Seoul 2 years ago. Slowly I came up with the idea of WørldWidæ Clothing and everything made sense in my life.

- Thank you guys for believeing in me and my team!

 

Carolina

My name is Carolina and i am born in sweden but moved to Norway when i was 9 years old. I have always had an interest in making things, and i used to sew and knit clothing to my pets when i was a teenager. I later discovered cosplay and started making my own costumes from games and movies. I have always liked fashion, but my interest grew when i learned about japanese fashion like lolita, decora and kei in 2011. It then grew over to South Korean fashion and i quickly found out that that it was trendsetting all over the world. I have always loved the thought of clothing being able to speak your personality and emotion, standing out not and wearing the same as everyone else and i think thats why i fell in love with the streetstyle in Korea. It is as unique and loving as the people wearing it. It expresses the emotion and creativity that we are given, and thats what i want with this company. I want the youth to be able to express themself in a way that is personal but also unique and trendsetting.

While visiting Venice, CA last summer I
fell in love with a particularly large and delicate piece of wall mounted
sculpture. No kidding, this piece was at least 3'x4' and I needed it for my NYC
office for a re-model I was wrapping up in just a few days. Instead of taking
chances with a commercial shipper, Dary actually arranged for a courier to

less than a week later and I could not have been more pleased... How's that for

personal service? Thanks Dary! - Alan Taylor, Client

column2: >We're a team of fashion, beauty and style enthusiasts with experience in business development, marketing, sales, healthcare and social media
column3: co-located in New York and Houston. We develop a monthly Style Box available via subscription, to help women stay in style during their pregnancy. Preggonista is also creating an online community where preggonistas can encourage each other, share information and enjoy special perks. Due to launch on Labor Day, we need your help to bring this into the world.

column1: Our campaign goals are twofold: One, raise $20,000 toward hard costs associated with this long-term venture, specifically to further build our inventory. And two, to establish relationships with businesses and brands who want to work with us to empower pregnant women. Whether you are a business or individual (you don't have to be pregnant!), you’ll enjoy the perks for your contributions. We’d appreciate your support toward making this a reality and hope that we’ll get to meet you either through one of our launch events or on PreggonistaTV!

column2: >In July 2012, Tamisha Piper, co-founder, admitted during a hushed phone call with co-founder, Tina Hawkins, that her pants were unbuttoned – while she was at work. Tamisha was nearing her sixth month of pregnancy and still hadn’t bought maternity clothes. Tina, not believing Tamisha’s claim that it was difficult to find maternity clothes, spent the weekend shopping and quickly discovered that, unless one finds muumuus appealing, it was difficult to find stylish maternity wear. The pair finally found six fashion essentials that Tamisha was able to style with her existing wardrobe to make it through her pregnancy with confidence.

column1: Inspired by this search, the co-founders developed an idea of a monthly subscription service that would take the pain out of the process and provide classic, wearable fashion essentials for style-obsessed pregnant women, along with an accessory to add a splash of color or texture, and a pregnancy-related beauty product.

In addition to the Style Box, Preggonista is also creating an online community where pregnant fashionistas can become inspired, encourage each other and share information. Enabled by social media and PreggonistaTV, the goal is to make this network a place where women receive support and draw inspiration. We hope to create a virtual home that they will be sad to leave!

Raising Funds – We are seeking to raise $20,000 for operating costs, including purchasing unique, stylish and high-quality products for our preggonistas and establishing a spot on delivery system to flawlesly store, pack and deliver each Style Box.

• If we exceed our goal: We will be able to expand the reach of our service to additional preggonistas. (With the ultimate goal being that we have such a huge, dynamic community of preggonistas that the top high-end brands come knocking down our doors to be in our Style Box! This also enables us to offer the Style Box at a lower price.)
• If we do not reach our goal: We will launch as planned using the funds raised, but will limit the number of members we can accept.
Establishing Relationships – We want to develop partnerships with brands and businesses with a common interest in preggonistas and feature products in our Style Boxes and flash sales.

column2: >Whether you’re an individual or business, we have some great perks to stash in your swag bag.
>If you can't contribute to the campaign or partner with us, you can still help! Please spread the word about our campaign to your social network.

column1: ","We're a team of fashion, beauty and style enthusiasts with experience in business development, marketing, sales, healthcare and social media
column2: co-located in New York and Houston. We develop a monthly Style Box available via subscription, to help women stay in style during their pregnancy. Preggonista is also creating an online community where preggonistas can encourage each other, share information and enjoy special perks. Due to launch on Labor Day, we need your help to bring this into the world.

column1: Our campaign goals are twofold: One, raise $20,000 toward hard costs associated with this long-term venture, specifically to further build our inventory. And two, to establish relationships with businesses and brands who want to work with us to empower pregnant women. Whether you are a business or individual (you don't have to be pregnant!), you’ll enjoy the perks for your contributions. We’d appreciate your support toward making this a reality and hope that we’ll get to meet you either through one of our launch events or on PreggonistaTV!

In July 2012, Tamisha Piper, co-founder, admitted during a hushed phone call with co-founder, Tina Hawkins, that her pants were unbuttoned – while she was at work. Tamisha was nearing her sixth month of pregnancy and still hadn’t bought maternity clothes. Tina, not believing Tamisha’s claim that it was difficult to find maternity clothes, spent the weekend shopping and quickly discovered that, unless one finds muumuus appealing, it was difficult to find stylish maternity wear. The pair finally found six fashion essentials that Tamisha was able to style with her existing wardrobe to make it through her pregnancy with confidence.

Inspired by this search, the co-founders developed an idea of a monthly subscription service that would take the pain out of the process and provide classic, wearable fashion essentials for style-obsessed pregnant women, along with an accessory to add a splash of color or texture, and a pregnancy-related beauty product.

In addition to the Style Box, Preggonista is also creating an online community where pregnant fashionistas can become inspired, encourage each other and share information. Enabled by social media and PreggonistaTV, the goal is to make this network a place where women receive support and draw inspiration. We hope to create a virtual home that they will be sad to leave!

Raising Funds – We are seeking to raise $20,000 for operating costs, including purchasing unique, stylish and high-quality products for our preggonistas and establishing a spot on delivery system to flawlesly store, pack and deliver each Style Box.

If we exceed our goal: We will be able to expand the reach of our service to additional preggonistas.
