Short Summary

Submarine is an independent T-shirt company focused on offering alternative and ethical clothing at as reasonable a price as possible. All our shirts are organic, hand printed with water based inks, and packaged with minimal impact on the environment. Being a student I spend half of my time compromising my morals when it comes to free range / organic / ethical products, due to the price associated with these options. The other half is spent searching for independent, quirky, and alternative clothing that I can identify with - only to discover, if I do find anything, I cant afford it. With Submarine I hope to remedy this by delivering high quality T-shirts, that are ethical and eco friendly, hand printed with cool designs and all for a price that undercuts T-shirts sold in chain stores or by other independent companies that have none of these attributes.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

We are looking for £700 to purchase the screen printing equipment and T-shirts we need to get Submarine running!

The money raised will pay for:

column1: • Screen printing carousel, screens, squeegees, ink, flash dryer, and all other equipment needed.
• Stickers, boxes, and swing tags for T-shirts.
• A launch event with great bands and a DJ in a quirky London venue.
• A photo shoot, promotional video, and a 'look book'.

We have set up price points for all budgets - every little helps! Submarine hopes to become a brand that you want to be a part of so (although it may sound cheesy!) when you contribute to this campaign you not only get the perk you selected but
column2:
> help establish a brand that will continue to provide you with alternative, ethical, and affordable products!

If you want a specific amount of custom T-shirts organic or otherwise send an email to submarineclothing2014@gmail.com and we can give you a quote!
column7:
>The Impact

Organic / eco friendly / ethical clothing should be a moral choice not a financial one. We want to better your choice and make a change in the way organic and ethical clothing s perceived, priced, and marketed. 

Our T-shirts are priced lower than non organic products sold by independent brands and big chains - if we can do it then why can't they? 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are un-able to help us financially you can still play a part in the success of this campaign! Help us spread the word - tell your friends what we are trying to achieve and share the campaign through social media. 

You can follow us on:

www.facebook.com/submarineclothing

www.pinterest.com/submarineclothing

Twitter: @submarine2014

Instagram: @submarineclothing

Our Story

Hi, we are Rosa Thurnher and Regina Weir. We are both from Atlanta and veterans in the fashion industry. We realized that there was a void of resources in the south for local designers to sustain a successful business, and because of this, we were losing our best talent to bigger cities such as New York and LA. Factory Girls was created to help fill that void and to give local designers access to resources that they need to compete on a global level. 

In December of 2013, we started a factory dedicated to high-level apparel manufacturing.  We currently provide studio space, access to pattern makers, sample makers and small run manufacturing for two designers Abbey Glass and Megan Huntz. We would like to expand our services to more designers across the Southeast and to jumpstart a viable industry with necessary resources locally available. 

We plan to build a full manufacturing facility, a classroom space that is open to the public, a computer lab with design and pattern making software, and private studios with storage spaces for low rent.  

Our goal is to not only foster talent but to create jobs and give access to sustainable local manufacturing. We hope to bring the fashion design community together and with our shared consciousness help bring Atlanta to the global fashion conversation.


The money that we raise will go to:

$12,500 for more industrial sewing machines.

$12,500 for a computer lab and software

$4,000 for pattern digitizing equipment. 

$6,000 for a pattern printer

$15,000 for labor


About the Perks:

We want to thank everyone who wants to be a part of our community and the perks are a way of showing our gratitude. 

At the end of our campaign we will be throwing a party at a secret location to be announced at the end of our campaign. Anyone contributing $25 or more will get a ticket to the final wrap party where we will have live bands including Ruby Velle &
column2: The Soulphonics, CLAWS,DJ SPEAKERFOXXX &
column3:
more, so we can dance and celebrate reaching our final goal!  

This exclusive piece from Abbey Glass is only available on our Indiegogo!
column9:
/>

Considering a customized piece from Abbey Glass or Megan Huntz? Check out their website to see more of their work.

Abbey Glass

Megan Huntz


Risks and Challenges:

We know that sourcing and finding skilled labor will be our main challenges as we ramp up our capabilities, but with the help of industry veterans we are sure that we can tackle these problems head on.  The ability to produce locally will ensure sustainable and ethical manufacturing, thus creating a positive environmental and economic impact.  


Biography

Rosa Thurnher is an Atlanta native who studied Fine Art at The University of Georgia. After college, she worked for ten years in retail sales and area management, fashion merchandising and visuals for retailers J.Crew and Armani Exchange. Her innate entrpreneurial spirit led her to a freelance career as a stylist and brand consultant. She is a lifelong collector of vintage fashion and owner of Recollection Vintage, a line that conveys current trends through vintage pieces. In 2009, Rosa started a pop-up marketplace Bodega to promote Atlanta brands and designers.

Regina Weir is also from Atlanta, but moved to New York after high school to attend NYU. After getting her degree at NYU, she stayed in New York and went to work at Madison Models and Code Model Management respectively as a modeling agent for 8 years. During that time, she also worked as a freelance stylist with stories published in magazines such as Esquire and Zink. Regina moved back to Atlanta in 2008 to help run her family's manufacturing business.

We are both from Atlanta and veterans in the fashion industry. We realized that there was a void of resources in the south for local designers to sustain a successful business, and because of this, we were losing our best talent to bigger cities such as New York and LA. Factory Girls was created to help fill that void and to give local designers access to resources that they need to compete on a global level. In December of 2013, we started a factory dedicated to high-level apparel manufacturing.  We currently provide studio space, access to pattern makers, sample makers and small run manufacturing for two designers Abbey Glass and Megan Huntz. We would like to expand our services to more designers across the Southeast and to jumpstart a viable industry with necessary resources locally available. We plan to build a full manufacturing facility, a classroom space that is open to the public, a computer lab with design and pattern making software, and private studios with storage spaces for low rent.  Our goal is to not only foster talent but to create jobs and give access to sustainable local manufacturing. We hope to bring the fashion design community together and with our shared consciousness help bring Atlanta to the global fashion conversation.The money that we raise will go to:$12,500 for more industrial sewing machines.$12,500 for a computer lab and software$4,000 for pattern digitizing equipment. $6,000 for a pattern printer$15,000 for laborAbout the Perks:We want to thank everyone who wants to be a part of our community and the perks are a way of showing our gratitude. At the end of our campaign we will be throwing a party at a secret location to be announced at the end of our campaign. Anyone contributing $25 or more will get a ticket to the final wrap party where we will have live bands including Ruby Velle & The Soulphonics, CLAWS,DJ SPEAKERFOXXX & more, so we can dance and celebrate reaching our final goal!  This exclusive piece from Abbey Glass is only available on our Indiegogo! Considering a customized piece from Abbey Glass or Megan Huntz? Check out their website to see more of their work.Abbey GlassMegan HuntzRisks and Challenges:We know that sourcing and finding skilled labor will be our main challenges as we ramp up our capabilities, but with the help of industry veterans we are sure that we can tackle these problems head on.  The ability to produce locally will ensure sustainable and ethical manufacturing, thus creating a positive environmental and economic impact.  BiographyRosa Thurnher is an Atlanta native who studied Fine Art at The University of Georgia. After college, she worked for ten years in retail sales and area management, fashion merchandising and visuals for retailers J.Crew and Armani Exchange. Her innate entrpreneurial spirit led her to a freelance career as a stylist and brand consultant. She is a lifelong collector of vintage fashion and owner of Recollection Vintage, a line that conveys current trends through vintage pieces. In 2009, Rosa started a pop-up marketplace Bodega to promote Atlanta brands and designers.Regina Weir is also from Atlanta, but moved to New York after high school to attend NYU. After getting her degree at NYU, she stayed in New York and went to work at Madison Models and Code Model Management respectively as a modeling agent for 8 years. During that time, she also worked as a freelance stylist with stories published in magazines such as Esquire and Zink. Regina moved back to Atlanta in 2008 to help run her family's manufacturing business.",2.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1:
0,"

Thank you for checking us out.   You rock!!!

Our product is The Soothing Back Vest. Like stated above, it helps support a painful, sore or aching back. We need start-up capital because we have never really had that. We have been trying to fund this business off of weekly paychecks.  And we had trouble finding investor is a bad economy. But I think, if we can raise some start-up capital (continuation capital, really) with your help, finding investors won't be as hard.

                       [Be an Actor in our 2015 commercial!!!  See below!]

We also want to show the Vest off at a Trade show or two. Money raised on this site will help get the Vest before the right people/companies.

Wow, you have a great idea, something that will help millions of people feel much better, and you think the rest is rich man history!  Oh no.

You show it to people, they love it, love it! But--the economy, I'm broke right now, I have too many bills, no one can purchase one or invest at the moment. And all those company's that ""show your invention"" want big money first! One such company wanted almost $11,000 over three years! 

My name is Jonell Murphy. I'm a substitute teacher and a paralegal (and a
future writer/inventor). My partner is Naipaul (Paul) Sookdeo. He is a

tailor/inventor. Our company is Sookdeo Tailoring.

Everyone knows someone with an aching or problem back. Our simple little vest helps that large world wide problem. With a hold, a grip, and pressure placed in all the right places. The back, the abdomen, the shoulders, everything held firm, tightly and comfortably. Yes--it looks like just a plain old vest, but 4 out of 6 people really feel the big difference once they try it on.

Our company, Sookdeo (sook-day-oh) Tailoring, has been working on this for almost two years, hitting dead end at every turn. Paul is the tailor that thought up this invention (patent pending) when he was having problems with his own aching back.  It seems the chiropractor just made him feel worst. So he sat at his trusty sewing machine (remember those) and solved his own painful problem. Then he showed it to me, his business partner Jonell.

So far Paul is a far better tailor than I am a business women. But I'm getting better and growing more of a spine everyday. And yes, I  have applied to Shark Tank! I can just image that waiting list!!! We want to be stronger when and if we get before the Sharks--you have seen them rip into companies that are not ready to rock!!!

There is a trade show, an annual event, in Pittsburgh in June. Even though we are cutting it close, I think that show will help us get the Soothing Back Vest before people and companies. And a second show later in the year or early in the beginning of next year will keep the momentum going for us--With your help.

Two trade shows would cost:

Trade show                                                               $1795

transportation to another state for 2              $500

Four day motel stay for 2                                    $1100

Material to make more samples                        $300

Food/tips/taxi/misc                                            $430

total                                                          ___________________

                                                                           $4125    x    2    =    $8250

Even if we just get enough for one show--great!!! 

The other $21,750.00 collected will be used to restart, set-up and prefect the vest, build up our advertising, reward the perks offered, and improve and grow our company.  We lost our place of business last year.  Now, if we get the money, we will be able to afford a new maybe better location.

Thank you.     J. Murphy and N. Sookdeo 

www.SoothingBackVest.com

Even $10.00 would be a God send. Give us a hand. Help us make this happen for all the bad backs in America. You can aid a struggling business.  Thank you so much!

Here are the Perks we are offering: 

The Soothing Back Vests,  (in multicolored pic below, real vest is bottom left)

An actor/actress in our commercial,

  A  small dog suit,

A copy of my children's book Pull,

A copy of my book of poetry,

A newly invented ""top secret"" board game, and more.
column5:
/>

If you don't have any $$$$ money right now, because--that's how it is

column1: for a lot of people--help us by telling five of your friends and family.

Just five other people.  Go to the top and Twitter about us or Facebook about us.  Thank you very much.   Jonell and Paul.

First of all we want to thank you for taking your time to read about Ambitious Movement.We hope you feel the passion we have towards Ambitious Movement Clothing.

column2: >Ambitious Movement (AM) is based out of Bay Area, Ca. Founded by Freddy and David. Both ambitious and having a want to create something of their own (to make a difference). They had an idea for a clothing line for people like them. Unfortunately the funds weren't available 2 years ago, so instead of just giving up on a dream they focused on brainstorming ideas, talked to printers, educated themselves about the industry, and spread the word about AM. Finally in 2012, they had saved enough funds to get a few shirts printed and get the business going.
>We represent the souls who were told that they wouldn't accomplish anything &amp
column3: those who are always under scrutiny. Ambitious Movement is here to motivate those lives through our clothing and to show them that it's fine to be rebellious in order to live YOUR life the way you want to live it.

column1: What have we done so far?
column2:
>We have settled in Davids garage, which has gotten a bit tight, but we try our hardest to make it work. We have been selling online and on the streets (out of our trunks), and events. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram (@AM_Clothing). 
  We want to increase our presence through bigger events and hopefully get some clothing in local shops. Your contribution will help support all of this!

>Our customers are important to us, and Indiegogo gives us the opportunity to get them involved. We want our customers to be a part of every step we take. Anyone that helps us out will receive something in return, everyone wins in our playbook. We consider you friends, you can email us just to chat, or even with ideas. We want to create a big AM Family!

column1: Why does Ambitious Movement need the money?
column2: >To grow and expand. The more we grow, the bigger chance we get to spread the movement. We are based in San Francisco, CA and would like to be involved in other areas.

column1: What will Ambitious Movement do with the money?
column2:
>AM will use the money for various purposes: 
      • Buy equipment we need to grow 
      • For advertisement and promotion to help spread AM
      • Print tees for women
      • More products (sweaters, Hoodies, Hats, etc.)
      • Start a new season

column1: What will Ambitious Movement do if they raise funds past their goal?
column2:
>First of all, that’ll be great if we raise funds past our goal!! And, if we do, the money will be used for:
      • Storage to make the garage more organized 
      • More products, Crewneck sweaters, Hoodies, Hats, etc. 
      • Advertising and promotion 
      • Attend more events, not just local but hopefully in different states

>We put our heart and soul into AM and we hope you can see that.
Thanks again.
>Here are a few shirts that we have printed. They may be yours if you donate($25+) to our campaign!

column1: To see more visit Ambitious-Movement.com
Contact:  We can easily be contacted via our Facebook, Twitter, E-Mail, or www.ambitious-movement.com
","First of all we want to thank you for taking your time to read about Ambitious Movement.We hope you feel the passion we have towards Ambitious Movement Clothing.

Ambitious Movement (AM) is based out of Bay Area, Ca. Founded by Freddy and David. Both ambitious and having a want to create something of their own (to make a difference). They had an idea for a clothing line for people like them. Unfortunately the funds weren't available 2 years ago, so instead of just giving up on a dream they focused on brainstorming ideas, talked to printers, educated themselves about the industry, and spread the word about AM. Finally in 2012, they had saved enough funds to get a few shirts printed and get the business going.

We represent the souls who were told that they wouldn't accomplish anything & those who are always under scrutiny. Ambitious Movement is here to motivate those lives through our clothing and to show them that it's fine to be rebellious in order to live YOUR life the way you want to live it.-We Live and Die With Ambition-

What have we done so far?    We have settled in Davids garage, which has gotten a bit tight, but we try our hardest to make it work. We have been selling online and on the streets (out of our trunks), and events. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram (@AM_Clothing).   We want to increase our presence through bigger events and hopefully get some clothing in local shops. Your contribution will help support all of this!

Why Indiegogo?    Our customers are important to us, and Indiegogo gives us the opportunity to get them involved. We want our customers to be a part of every step we take. Anyone that helps us out will receive something in return, everyone wins in our playbook. We consider you friends, you can email us just to chat, or even with ideas. We want to create a big AM Family!

Why does Ambitious Movement need the money?    To grow and expand. The more we grow, the bigger chance we get to spread the movement. We are based in San Francisco, CA and would like to be involved in other areas.

What will Ambitious Movement do with the money?    AM will use the money for various purposes:       •	Buy equipment we need to grow       •	For advertisement and promotion to help spread AM      •	Print tees for women      •	More products (sweaters, Hoodies, Hats, etc.)      •	Start a new season

What will Ambitious Movement do if they raise funds past their goal?    First of all, that’ll be great if we raise funds past our goal!! And, if we do, the money will be used for:      •	Storage to make the garage more organized       •	More products, Crewneck sweaters, Hoodies, Hats, etc.       •	Advertising and promotion       • Attend more events, not just local but hopefully in different states
We put our heart and soul into AM and we hope you can see that.Thanks again.
Here are a few shirts that we have printed. They may be yours if you donate($25+) to our campaign!
Contact:  We can easily be contacted via our Facebook, Twitter, E-Mail, or www.ambitious-movement.com",5.0,0,"1 Campaign
0,"

The LucidaCam is a graphics tool that can help you trace the correct perspective view of your subject, quickly and easily. You see the complete view of your subject in front of you through the LucidaCam viewer.  Not partial views or upside down as in other ""Lucida"" type drawing devices.

The LucidaCam was created using state of the art 3D CAD Design Software and prototypes were printed on 3D Printers to test the optics and ergonomics of the design. We feel that THIS! design is hands down the lowest cost, largest view, easiest to look through copy/trace device of its type soon to be available!

With your Funding Help, we can make these devices a reality and available to everyone who wants a LucidaCam. First production ships 60 days after the Kickstarter campaign ends. We are looking at January 2014 to begin shipping orders out and will continue shipping until all orders are filled.

(NOTE: Because we have done all our pre-production work we only need to order the injection molds based on our designs, deliver the mold base to the molding house and place the orders for the bendable clamping arms from our suppliers. Other parts like cut mirrors and machined small parts will be made by our shop and assembled with local help - This is our goal!)

Included with every LucidaCam will be a software CD that has all the LucidaCam instructions, study lessons and tips to help you use the LucidaCam correctly and successfully, and the history of the original Camera Lucida devices from the 1800's to 1960's that inspired the development of the modern day version ""LucidaCam"" (only for Windows Computers only at this time).

column2: >LucidaCam CD with Instructions, Tips Camera Lucida History

column1: The LucidaCam can help you get started with any art project by letting you see your projected image right on your drawing paper, canvas, board, leather or cake (Yes! - Cake Decorating!) in correct perspective. Once this is done you will have an accurate view whereby you can trace around this image while looking through the LucidaCam eyepiece.

You can transfer an image from your computer, photograph or other subject to your work media. Even Tattoo artists have used our prototypes to transfer art from a design to carbon paper to be applied to a customer for Tattooing.

As a professional Aerospace Draftsman, Engineer and then Inspector, I always found that I could draw straight lines, parallel lines with square shapes, circles and complex polygons with correct scale and accuracy easily, this is what I did day in and day out.

In moving from being a Draftsman and Engineer to wanting to become an Artist for personal enjoyment, I discovered that drawing a Landscape Scene, a Vase, Flowers, Animals or Birds, the Human Form or a Face was like hitting a giant brick wall.

My drawings looked like a 7 year old attempted the feat, the things I learned as a draftsman had virtually no correlation to drawing real life scenes or objects that were not rocket engines, space shuttles, airplanes and the thousands of sub component parts I was used to drawing.

This was beyond frustrating!  How is it that I could I draw a Billion Dollar Spacecraft and fail to be able to draw even a simple creature like the Blue Crabs that I so loved to catch and eat in the summer months on the Jersey Shore.

Frustration had only gotten worse when I was too busy to attend art classes to learn to draw real life subjects was out of the question, I had no time because of work schedules, money and transportation issues were mounting. I Love Art and want to draw and paint like the Masters, I needed to find a Solution.

After searching the internet for a device purportedly called a ""Camera Lucida"" whereby a subject could be drawn from still life or landscape and accurately transferred to paper in the correct perspective, I felt that this might possibly be the solution.

Ancient Camera Lucidas from as far away as France and Israel were purchased at great expense to be able to reverse engineer the optics behind the original early designs and discover how they worked or didn’t work as was the case.

These early Camera Lucidas were disassembled and studied to discover the advantages and disadvantages of the tiny glass prisms optical qualities. It was discovered through trial and error testing with an actual original early 1900's Camera Lucida obtained from Israel (and made by the French optics manufacturer P. Berville of Paris), that viewing and squinting to see through such a tiny prism is difficult at best and only offers a partial image that must be constantly adjusted and moved to allow for drawing the whole scene.

The early photographic pioneer “William Fox Talbot” who in 1833, was so disappointed with the Tiny Viewing Prism used in the Camera Lucida that it drove him to invent photography, to “Cause these images to imprint themselves durably”.

We have learned from experimentation with the mirrored prism mistakes others historically have made in the past, and developed a means to obtain the same effect of transferring a viewed image to paper or other art media accurately using 3D Printed CAD prototype models.

We have studied the optical qualities of using 2 plastic mirrors to obtain the larger higher quality image results, and a far greater viewing field which allows for less strain with greater clarity because you are not constantly “Squinting” and adjusting to see through a tiny prism.
It might be falsely stated that the LucidaCam is just a copy of the 1950’s 60’s “Master Art Helper” copying device made popular in advertisement sections of Popular Science and similar magazines.

This would simply be like comparing the fact that Aircraft built in the 1950’s are still old and outdated today simply because they share the same fact that they have Engines and Wings!.  Today we have Mach 3+ Aircraft and we have sent spacecraft outside our solar system while Rovers travel around the surface of Mars. Things have changed since the 1950’s, and the LucidaCam has incorporated all the advancements available to us using the most modern means at our disposal.

We obviously know that since the 1950’s, Computers and 3D Modeling of designs have come along and allowed us to develop a new and far more advanced version of the earlier table top copy devices popularized in the backs of magazines. The LucidaCam addresses all the older failings and is a Modern version""On Steroids!"" that uses a “Different” mirror angle (Not the 45 Degree angle of mirrors used for years in those devices).

We found an angle that works BETTER! Enclosing the mirrors inside a cylindrical black ABS tube isolates the viewing image in darkness to allow for better viewing. No more rigid rods or erector-set type large and bulky mounting arms that won’t allow for simple quick adjustments.

column2: >Actual Bust Image of Benjamin Franklin as seen clearly through the LucidaCam

column1: Same Franklin bust sitting on table for comparative viewing

The LucidaCam will allow you to draw your subject in FULL VIEW, not in half or partial view like the tiny prism Camera Lucida designs, and the picture will be Right SIde Up! - Never Upside Down as in the older prism based Camera Lucida devices.

The LucidaCam can be used by both Right and Left handed artists because of the large 18 inch long bendable arm and sturdy clamp base. The LucidaCam can be flexed and clamped to the most comfortable location on the right side of any table or artists easel and allows for plenty of hand movement underneath to draw by either left or right handed persons.

We are relying on 100% American made parts to build the LucidaCam.  We decided that the bendable mounting arms that could have been sourced from cheaper Chinese manufacturers were not up to the quality standards we demanded. So we found a reliable American manufacturer to supply these higher quality stronger arms.

The cheaper Chinese flex arms would not retain their memory in place and wiggled while clamped to a table, which made it difficult to draw, although costing twice the Chinese prices we think the quality justifies the added cost!.

The injection molded LucidaCam body parts will be made in New Jersey at an injection molding house that makes over 11 million dollars worth of medical grade plastic components each year therefore the quality of our LucidaCam will Not be compromised by cheap overseas molding houses.

The 2 internal Primary and Secondary mirrors will be made from American plastics and laser cut here in Pennsylvania. The small internal screw cap holding the LucidaCam to the Bendable Arm will be machined in Pennsylvania as well. And all components will be assembled and tested using local labor here in PA. Thus adding money to our Local economy and not sending our work overseas.
Transferring images from your computer screen onto drawing media, canvas, paper or gesso coated masonite.
Transferring artwork from photographs or still life to carbon paper for Tattoo artists.
Transferring images onto wood, leather or other craft projects.
Transferring images onto sheet or round cakes - Yes! Cake Decorating

As an Engineer and mechanical designer, I (Gregory Matherly) as the principal designer of the LucidaCam, am fully qualified to test and direct the manufacture of the LucidaCam, with the network of machinists and molding houses at our disposal.
We have a trusted group of suppliers to manufacture the LucidaCam sub components. Blanket orders for parts have been negotiated, and all costs and shipping details have been done.

A clear understanding of actual costs has been established BEFORE we go into full production. There will be no surprises or delays due to poor selection of materials or engineering deficiencies in design.

You won't be getting Email's from us with a sad story or supposed change due to some underestimate of actual cost for production or a cheaper substitute clamping arm being switched at the last moment.

Our desire is to be able to raise the required funding to purchase the very expensive plastic injection molds, the initial run of bendable flex arms, mirrors, screws and small machined caps. Our hope is that you will also see the potential that the LucidaCam can make in a budding or even an experienced artist to improve their drawing skills.
""Anyone can be an artist - With LucidaCam""

Gregory D. Matherly is currently a Design and Applications Engineer working for a leading Dissolution consumables manufacturer, Quality Lab Accessories LLC., making devices used in the Pharmaceutical drug development industry.

In the early 1980's to mid 1990's, Greg was instrumental in working on numerous aerospace projects, including helping with the manufacture of 3 Space Shuttle orbiters, Discovery, Columbia and Atlantis with Rockwell International, in Palmdale, Ca.

Then went on to work as a senior Inspector for Rocketdyne/Boeing, in the final assembly of the engines used in the Space Shuttle orbiters, also working on the Atlas MA-5a and Delta Delta RS-27 expendable rocket engines used for lifting heavy satellite payloads and assisted in the manufacture of the B1-B Lancer Strategic intercontinental Bomber, developed and assembled in Palmdale, Ca.

Greg has 31 years combined Aerospace and Medical design experience, with the last 18 years using CAD (Computer Aided Design) principles to develop some of the World's most advanced vehicles and pharmaceutical test equipment.  Researching and developing the LucidaCam is one of his personal favorites by far!

Although risk is a factor in any manufacturing endeavor, we have minimized all possible failure points in each step of the process by looking into supply chain weaknesses, the possibility of manufacturing problems, as well as packaging and shipping issues.

All were addressed individually and possible solutions to each were laid out before we took on the task of developing this product. With the experience of our machine shop sources and injection mold supplier, it is likely that No problems will occur during manufacture of the LucidaCam, but if they do we feel that we have addressed each possible problem enough to administer a quick solution.

These early Camera Lucidas were disassembled and studied to discover the advantages and disadvantages of the tiny glass prisms optical qualities. It was discovered through trial and error testing with an actual original early 1900's Camera Lucida obtained from Israel (and made by the French optics manufacturer P. Berville of Paris), that viewing and squinting to see through such a tiny prism is difficult at best and only offers a partial image that must be constantly adjusted and moved to allow for drawing the whole scene.

The early photographic pioneer “William Fox Talbot” who in 1833, was so disappointed with the Tiny Viewing Prism used in the Camera Lucida that it drove him to invent photography, to “Cause these images to imprint themselves durably”.

We have learned from experimentation with the mirrored prism mistakes others historically have made in the past, and developed a means to obtain the same effect of transferring a viewed image to paper or other art media accurately using 3D Printed CAD prototype models.

We have studied the optical qualities of using 2 plastic mirrors to obtain the larger higher quality image results, and a far greater viewing field which allows for less strain with greater clarity because you are not constantly “Squinting” and adjusting to see through a tiny prism.
It might be falsely stated that the LucidaCam is just a copy of the 1950’s 60’s “Master Art Helper” copying device made popular in advertisement sections of Popular Science and similar magazines.

This would simply be like comparing the fact that Aircraft built in the 1950’s are still old and outdated today simply because they share the same fact that they have Engines and Wings!.  Today we have Mach 3+ Aircraft and we have sent spacecraft outside our solar system while Rovers travel around the surface of Mars. Things have changed since the 1950’s, and the LucidaCam has incorporated all the advancements available to us using the most modern means at our disposal.

We obviously know that since the 1950’s, Computers and 3D Modeling of designs have come along and allowed us to develop a new and far more advanced version of the earlier table top copy devices popularized in the backs of magazines. The LucidaCam addresses all the older failings and is a Modern version""On Steroids!"" that uses a “Different” mirror angle (Not the 45 Degree angle of mirrors used for years in those devices).

We found an angle that works BETTER! Enclosing the mirrors inside a cylindrical black ABS tube isolates the viewing image in darkness to allow for better viewing. No more rigid rods or erector-set type large and bulky mounting arms that won’t allow for simple quick adjustments.
Actual Bust Image of Benjamin Franklin as seen clearly through the LucidaCam
Same Franklin bust sitting on table for comparative viewing

The LucidaCam will allow you to draw your subject in FULL VIEW, not in half or partial view like the tiny prism Camera Lucida designs, and the picture will be Right SIde Up! - Never Upside Down as in the older prism based Camera Lucida devices.

The LucidaCam can be used by both Right and Left handed artists because of the large 18 inch long bendable arm and sturdy clamp base. The LucidaCam can be flexed and clamped to the most comfortable location on the right side of any table or artists easel and allows for plenty of hand movement underneath to draw by either left or right handed persons.

We are relying on 100% American made parts to build the LucidaCam.  We decided that the bendable mounting arms that could have been sourced from cheaper Chinese manufacturers were not up to the quality standards we demanded. So we found a reliable American manufacturer to supply these higher quality stronger arms.

The cheaper Chinese flex arms would not retain their memory in place and wiggled while clamped to a table, which made it difficult to draw, although costing twice the Chinese prices we think the quality justifies the added cost!.

The injection molded LucidaCam body parts will be made in New Jersey at an injection molding house that makes over 11 million dollars worth of medical grade plastic components each year therefore the quality of our LucidaCam will Not be compromised by cheap overseas molding houses.

The 2 internal Primary and Secondary mirrors will be made from American plastics and laser cut here in Pennsylvania. The small internal screw cap holding the LucidaCam to the Bendable Arm will be machined in Pennsylvania as well. And all components will be assembled and tested using local labor here in PA. Thus adding money to our Local economy and not sending our work overseas.
Transferring images from your computer screen onto drawing media, canvas, paper or gesso coated masonite.
Transferring artwork from photographs or still life to carbon paper for Tattoo artists.
Transferring images onto wood, leather or other craft projects.
Transferring images onto sheet or round cakes - Yes! Cake Decorating

As an Engineer and mechanical designer, I (Gregory Matherly) as the principal designer of the LucidaCam, am fully qualified to test and direct the manufacture of the LucidaCam, with the network of machinists and molding houses at our disposal.
We have a trusted group of suppliers to manufacture the LucidaCam sub components. Blanket orders for parts have been negotiated, and all costs and shipping details have been done.

A clear understanding of actual costs has been established BEFORE we go into full production. There will be no surprises or delays due to poor selection of materials or engineering deficiencies in design.

You won't be getting Email's from us with a sad story or supposed change due to some underestimate of actual cost for production or a cheaper substitute clamping arm being switched at the last moment.

Our desire is to be able to raise the required funding to purchase the very expensive plastic injection molds, the initial run of bendable flex arms, mirrors, screws and small machined caps. Our hope is that you will also see the potential that the LucidaCam can make in a budding or even an experienced artist to improve their drawing skills.
""Anyone can be an artist - With LucidaCam""

Gregory D. Matherly is currently a Design and Applications Engineer working for a leading Dissolution consumables manufacturer, Quality Lab Accessories LLC., making devices used in the Pharmaceutical drug development industry.

In the early 1980's to mid 1990's, Greg was instrumental in working on numerous aerospace projects, including helping with the manufacture of 3 Space Shuttle orbiters, Discovery, Columbia and Atlantis with Rockwell International, in Palmdale, Ca.

Then went on to work as a senior Inspector for Rocketdyne/Boeing, in the final assembly of the engines used in the Space Shuttle orbiters, also working on the Atlas MA-5a and Delta Delta RS-27 expendable rocket engines used for lifting heavy satellite payloads and assisted in the manufacture of the B1-B Lancer Strategic intercontinental Bomber, developed and assembled in Palmdale, Ca.

Greg has 31 years combined Aerospace and Medical design experience, with the last 18 years using CAD (Computer Aided Design) principles to develop some of the World's most advanced vehicles and pharmaceutical test equipment.  Researching and developing the LucidaCam is one of his personal favorites by far!

Although risk is a factor in any manufacturing endeavor, we have minimized all possible failure points in each step of the process by looking into supply chain weaknesses, the possibility of manufacturing problems, as well as packaging and shipping issues.

All were addressed individually and possible solutions to each were laid out before we took on the task of developing this product. With the experience of our machine shop sources and injection mold supplier, it is likely that No problems will occur during manufacture of the LucidaCam, but if they do we feel that we have addressed each possible problem enough to administer a quick solution.",32.0,0,"1 Campaign
0,"

We have been running boxing programs in Palestine for almost two years with a vision to seeing our young boys and girls rise above the politics and represent their community proudly at the Olympic Games.
We see sport as a way to a better life, through better health, education, discipline and creation of opportunities for young people that may never have otherwise existed.
As Nelson Mandela once said ""Sport speaks to young people in a language they understand"" - our vision to reach young people and inspire them to be great in whatever they choose to do.
Palestine MMA is a non-profit sports organisation established to provide young people in Palestine with a cheap, safe and fun way to remain engaged in physical and meaningful activity.

We are not a 'flash in the pan' NGO looking for a great photo opp, we are here to stay and looking at encouraging sustainable sports programs run by local people, for local people, with a dream to breed champions, in sport and in life.

We have been running programs around the streets in Palestine, in whatever space we can get. To ensure our programs remain sustainable, and continue to serve the community - we need to establish a home in the form of a gym, that can accommodate a range of sports programs, including boxing!

We currently have a great boxing coach and an enthusiastic group of boys and girls that train with us regularly. We have been able to raise enough funds to provide the basic equipment, but would love to be able to provide them with a boxing ring to help them better prepare for international competitions.
• A Boxing ring will cost us approximately 6000 USD, we have some funds that we are allocating to this, but we are still well short!

• Your contribution would be highly valued and would provide the seed funding to develop a dream and launch Palestinian athletes onto the world stage - Think Cuban Olympic Boxing Team, Jamaican Athletes and Palestinians right up beside them on the podium.
• Every cent raised will go to the purchase of a boxing ring to support our boxing programs and Palestinian Youth

70% of the Palestinian Population is under the age of 24, with excessively high youth unemployment rates and limited access to recreational facilities. Our programs provide a fun and safe outlet with a view towards supporting individuals in pursuing a happier, healthier and more fruitful life.

This includes providing participants with various pathways in sports, both as athletes, or as coaches and administrators. We have partnered with Rise Global (www.rise-global.com) to look at how to best develop the sector, so as to ensure maximum benefits to Palestinian Youth and the community at large and contributing to a vibrant sports sector in Palestine
We share our vision with you, so you can also share it with your friends, family and extensive network of like minded, well intentioned folk.
• If you want to stay involved, please contact us via our website www.palestinemma.org

And that’s all there is to it!

The Boombot REX is a wireless ultraportable speaker built for life in motion. This is the result of cramming creatives, audiophiles, DJs and athletes in a garage tucked away in the heart of San Francisco’s Mission District with a vision: Build a speaker with unparalleled power-to-size ratio and unmatched versatility. Our goal isn’t merely to create an ultraportable speaker, but to define the entire category.

The built-on clip of the Boombot REX allows you to stay connected to your friends and your music while keeping your phone safely in your pocket. Your phone isn't the only thing that will be safer—whether you're cycling, skateboarding or skiing, the Boombot REX provides a much safer alternative to listening to music than headphones. Featuring a design built to withstand the demands of an active lifestyle, you can bring music to where you want it most. Additionally the Boombot REX is compatible with all smartphones, tablets, iPods, and laptops using Bluetooth wireless technology.

Over the past five months, we've evolved this project using cutting edge graphic application technology and professionally mastered equalization. We've made the Boombot REX sound better and ride harder than ever before. We are paving the way for manufacturing techniques and using this opporunity to drive change. This is the Boombot REX Limited Series.

In the product launch, we are donating 20% of our revenues to support BMEF (Bicycle Messenger Emergency Fund). You will receive a discount on the Boombot REX Limited Edition wireless speaker as well. Backers can pick from one of three exclusive designs and support a great cause.

BMEF (Bicycle Messenger Emergency Fund) is a non profit organization dedicated to helping injured bike messengers. In our campaign, we hope to raise $10,000 for this fund while improving bike safety around the world.
WHAT YOU WILL GET FROM THIS:
• A pre-order of the Boombot REX wireless speaker in a LTD edition (early August delivery)
• Visibility of your direct impact on the project and an inside view of the underground world of messenger bikers
• The warm fuzzy feeling of doing good for the world
• Endless hours of great music and fun and a safer alternative to headphones
Each unit includes a USB charger, auxiliary male-to-male connector for direct line-in.

Our team has been building ultraportable speakers for years now and we have experienced the pleasure and pain of hardware. You may have seen us launch the first Boombot REX on Kickstarter last year. The success of the campaign inspired us to figure out what we could do to evolve our product design while driving social imact. We spent the last several months delivering a solid product to our first backers and dreaming about what we could do to make the best even better. This is not our first rodeo and certainly not our last.
Lief Storer’s permanent state of discontent mixed with limitless passion drives R&
column2: D to its farthest limits. With an engineering background developing high-power intelligent LED/fiberoptic lighting systems he brings electromechanical and industrial design expertise. Chris McKleroy developed the original Boombot REX concept, and continues to be involved with the manufacturing and project management.

column1: Our crew now consists of eight hungry people crammed into a studio-loft-garage in San Francisco's Mission District. When you have round-the-clock R&
column2: D on a speaker system loud enough to fill up the whole room, there is never a silent moment in the office.

column1: Boombotix started in 2010 making ultraportable speakers. Lief envisioned a stronger way to connect people through music. The original Boombot was crafted in 2010 as a way to bike commute safer, while still enjoying music—anyone who rides with headphones can attest to how dangerous they can be. The product was then seeded into the transient lifestyles of surf, skate and snow communities where the utility of the product was fully realized.
Three years later, Boombotix has carved a niche as a pioneer in wearable technology and streaming music by leveraging innovative design, software and a strong community of avid users.

Combine smooth looks with a soft touch on the Limited Edition Boombot REX Brushed. With a shiny anodized grill, this model incorporates a subtle aluminum texture found only on the most elite gadgetry. For a speaker that can take a beating, we make it a point to look the part. Limited to 1000 pieces worldwide.

With several shades of brown and a stunning blue splatter, the Limited Edition Boombot REX Mudrunner was inspired by those bikes that like to ride dirty. Whether on your handle bars or fastened to your pack, the Mudrunner is made for the messiest of adventures. This model was designed by the CEO of our company, Lief Storer. Limited to 1000 pieces worldwide.

The Plox pattern was initially sketched by hand and vectorized in a 2-color graphic. Think of Plox as the hybrid of gator skin. Designed by Chris McKleroy, our VP of Product, it's tough, relentless, and a true force of nature. Only 1000 pieces available worldwide.
• Battery indicator displays on most mobile devices
If you've read this far, you probably already want this wireless speaker. In the event you need a few more reasons to get off the fence, take a gander below.

The life of a bike messenger is to get your stuff from one part of town to another in the least amount of time. Their day consists of weaving between traffic to get people the stuff they need. One accident can instantly take them out of the work force. They barely make enough wages to get by in the expensive urban areas where they work, let alone create a safety net in case of an emergency. Here is our chance to support a community that is working hard every day to make ends meet.

Boombots will change your life. They add a soundtrack unlike anything else. Summer is here and you should be getting outside and enjoying it. Whether you're at the beach, boardwalk or taking a hike, there are tons of occasions where you're going to find this product useful.

In many states, riding with headphones is illegal. Those of us who have (or still do, for that matter) biked with headphones long enough can speak to a couple close calls in traffic. Boombots help to connect you with your environment better than headphones. Not only can you bump your tunes, but you can also interface with your phone handsfree, receive directions and command voice control.

The Boombotix team is a group of ambitious visionaries that want to make the world better through sound. We are creating jobs, driving innovation and pushing the frontier of audio technology. We need your continued support to continue building the devices you love.

Our team is currently working to develop an app that allows music to stream to multiple mobile devices in sync. This technology is not only fun for doing group playback but may also have other applications in community development, music discovery and social interaciton.

column2: />The Bicycle Messenger Emergency Fund  is a 501 c3 non profit public charity organization that provides emergency compensation to bicycle messengers who are hurt on the job. Currently the BMEF allocates a $500 emergency check to help messengers anywhere during the first week of injury. This provides a boost, to both the financial and the emotional state of the injured messenger. The goal is to help the messenger cope and recover.

column1: Lucas Brunelle is a professional bike videographer. He has documented biking around the world using his custom helmet cameras. He has been known for capturing riders taking calculated risks. He has pushed riders to go faster and harder than they've ever gone before. Lucas joined the BMEF back in 2009 as his way of giving back to the community he cares about.  We are thankful to have Lucas helping us promote this campaign.

The journey with Boombotix never ends. We will be keeping all of our backers updated with the exact metrics of our campaign. You can share your impact with your friends and family and hopefully convince them to get on board for the cause.  Some really easy things to do are:
• Share this campaign with your social network (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram)
• Write about your impact on your blog and help raise awareness
• Tell your friends about the cause and get people stoked
When you get your Boombot REX, you'll be able to have a soundtrack in your life.  And you can tell everyone about how you helped make the world a better place through your love for music and sound.
Q: Why is the perk value on the page different from the price I see on the right hand column?
A: The domestic shipping cost of $8 has been included in each perk. For international backers, additional shipping costs should be added to the contribution.
Q: If you guys don't reach the $50k goal, will the product still be manufactured?
A: Yes. We are already assemblying product. This campaign was primarily to support a charity we care about. Our delivery is still projected for August.
Q: I want a Boombot REX, but I just want one of the normal colored ones.  Can I still support the campaign?
A: Yes! You can purchase any of the $108 perks and we will send out a survey at the end of the campaign. You can pick from any available color on the site.
Q: What kind of warranty do you guys offer?

A: We offer a thing called the No Matter What One Year Warranty. Should you have any problem with the performance of your speaker during the first year of use, you are entitled to free repair/replacement.

column2: >We also offer an
column4: > where you can take any old Boombot speaker and trade it in for a $25 credit towards any new model of your choice.

column3: >Boombots are made with a contract manufacturer in Shenzhen, China. We have been working with this manufacturer for three years. We have confidence that this manufacturer can deliver a solid product in a timely manner. We have already taken a lot of measurements on this production run to get the projects moving along before this campaign has even started. We are confident that we will be able to get these units to our customers in a timely fashion.

column1: Q: What differentiates these speakers from all the others on the market?

We have done extensive work on the acoustics and design of our products to insure that it is the industry leader in power-to-size ratio. You can check out some of the portable speaker comparisons we've done on our blog.

I launched Esty Lingerie over 3 years ago as a student. Originally a very small site selling only my own creations, it's now the largest online boutique dedicated to independent and handmade lingerie brands.
The Buttercup beaded bra in lemon satin from my first collection.

Although my own collection is only one of over 30 brands now at Esty Lingerie, it's always been my favourite part of what I do. Since the very first collection, Buttercup (pictured above), my philosophy has always been the same - luxurious lingerie that costs no more than your typical everyday lingerie would.
The Buttercup beaded babydoll, as featured in the Daily Mail. This set, including the thong, was £39.99 and my favourite thing I've ever designed!

This means I spend a lot of time researching fabrics and trims to find the best quality at the best price. I also don't spend a fortune on photography, and I sew most pieces myself which keeps production costs down.
The Buttercup corset, which I also offered as a custom item in other colours.
My first collection Buttercup wasn't intended to be a bridal range, but it was mostly brides who bought it. Since then I've released 5 more collections but have yet to create an actual bridal range.
The Valentine Kiss corset I designed for UK Chocolate Magazine (now UK Gent Magazine). This in ivory and pale gold would be perfect as bridalwear!

I'm now a bride-to-be myself and it's got me thinking about bridal lingerie all the time! However, everywhere I look I can only find affordable-but-boring bridal lingerie or beautiful pieces that are well out of my (and most people's) price range.
A few pieces from my second collection, Violet, with gorgeous tasselled trims!

So I'm planning to work on my first proper bridal lingerie range later this year, to launch in Spring/Summer 2014. As with all my lingerie, the focus will be on using beautiful fabrics, putting lots of effort into the small details and, importantly, doing it all on a budget so that I can sell everything for £50 or less.
A black and gold Esty Lingerie corset. Photographer: Abi Oshodi, Stylist: Abigail Ayoola, Make Up: Flora Losilo, Model: Abby Munro

Other than a more affordable bridal lingerie choice if you happen to be getting married next year, I have lots of fantastic goodies available for those who contribute - everything from small accessories to beautiful corsets like the one below!
A beaded Esty Lingerie corset (shown with Petits Secrets knickers) - one of these could be yours if you contribute to this campaign!

I launched Esty Lingerie over 3 years ago as a student. Originally a very small site selling only my own creations, it's now the largest online boutique dedicated to independent and handmade lingerie brands.
The Buttercup beaded bra in lemon satin from my first collection.

Although my own collection is only one of over 30 brands now at Esty Lingerie, it's always been my favourite part of what I do. Since the very first collection, Buttercup (pictured above), my philosophy has always been the same - luxurious lingerie that costs no more than your typical everyday lingerie would.
The Buttercup beaded babydoll, as featured in the Daily Mail. This set, including the thong, was £39.99 and my favourite thing I've ever designed!

This means I spend a lot of time researching fabrics and trims to find the best quality at the best price. I also don't spend a fortune on photography, and I sew most pieces myself which keeps production costs down.
The Buttercup corset, which I also offered as a custom item in other colours.
My first collection Buttercup wasn't intended to be a bridal range, but it was mostly brides who bought it. Since then I've released 5 more collections but have yet to create an actual bridal range.
The Valentine Kiss corset I designed for UK Chocolate Magazine (now UK Gent Magazine). This in ivory and pale gold would be perfect as bridalwear!

I'm now a bride-to-be myself and it's got me thinking about bridal lingerie all the time! However, everywhere I look I can only find affordable-but-boring bridal lingerie or beautiful pieces that are well out of my (and most people's) price range.
A few pieces from my second collection, Violet, with gorgeous tasselled trims!

So I'm planning to work on my first proper bridal lingerie range later this year, to launch in Spring/Summer 2014. As with all my lingerie, the focus will be on using beautiful fabrics, putting lots of effort into the small details and, importantly, doing it all on a budget so that I can sell everything for £50 or less.
A black and gold Esty Lingerie corset. Photographer: Abi Oshodi, Stylist: Abigail Ayoola, Make Up: Flora Losilo, Model: Abby Munro

Other than a more affordable bridal lingerie choice if you happen to be getting married next year, I have lots of fantastic goodies available for those who contribute - everything from small accessories to beautiful corsets like the one below!
A beaded Esty Lingerie corset (shown with Petits Secrets knickers) - one of these could be yours if you contribute to this campaign!",7.0,0,"1 Campaign
My names is Vanion Paradis, I am a graphic artist recently out of college. I have a background in Graphic Design, Video Game Design, 2D/3D art and animation.
I am looking to set up a high quality home printer in order to create, print, and sell my own prints and artwork. Being recently out of school I could use all the help I can get!
The printer I'm looking to acquire is approximately $300.00 (including rebates, discounts, and taxes).
The high quality semi-matte paper is around $60 for 50 sheets of the largest size (this can be purchased on demand).

I'm hoping to raise at least $360 for the majority of the cost. Of course any amount (less or more) would go a long way in getting me on my feet in this venture. Anything exceeding my goals will go towards a higher quality cutter, more inks, paper styles and sizes, as well as any other supplies that could help make this business become successful.

As a thank you for your contributions I have a wide range of prints and packages available for you as the different perks. Some of the packages have the opportunity to have a custom print created, this means that I will be creating a print specifically for you around any subject, person or anything sentimental to you. It's completely up to you!

Please note: I cannot do a custom print featuring any trademarked/copywritten characters not owned by you. I retain the rights to reuse and sell the custom prints, although any personal info and such will be removed. If you own or intend to own a character you want featured in a print, I will not sell or redistribute the print featuring the character without explicit permission.
To take a look at my current selection click HERE

Here you can see available prints and their sizes (I will attempt to get sizes as close to the nearest frameable size, possibly using a border as long as it suits the image). As well you can see prints that are coming soon (most of which should be finished by the end of the campaign and will be available to be chosen, but I cannot make any guarantees).

Professional make-up artist Coral Melnyk has offered her time and skills to make abstract canvas paintings to give away as perks for this campaign! Pictures of her previous works will be posted shortly. Visit her website www.coralmelnyk.com or follow her on twitter @CoralMelnyk (www.twitter.com/CoralMelnyk)

If you have a look at the perks you will see I am doing digital/paper sketches. On paper it will be done in black ink or pitt pen on 6x6 bristol board. Preferrably a cartoony request would be easier for me, but I can do more complicated styles when given the time. Same goes for the comic strip.

Please have a look at the awesome space themed perk packages to the right... Why space themed you might ask? Well it's a fact that everything space themed is just that much cooler (Ex. Dinosaur.... Space Dinosaur. You tell me which is better!)

If this project is successful, it would allow me the opportunity to go to places like Fan-Expo and Comic-Con and have the chance to have signage and sell my work at a reasonable cost. This benefits both myself as well as any potential customers and gives me the opportunity to actually show off my work or do custom prints without having to set orders exceeding 50 copies to get a fair price.

Not to mention this will help me get started on future projects as well, such as hosting charity events with other artists selling/auctioning their work, a children's book with professional make-up artist Coral Melnyk (a project which is currently underway. Story by Coral, Illustrations by me), and much more!
Even if you can't contribute financially, just letting other people know about my campaign is plenty of help in this endevour. Tweet, Share, Mention in a post
column2: Do whatever you can to get the word out there.

column1: You can follow me on twitter for more updates @VanionParadis
My website is located at www.vanionparadis.co.nr for the time being

Hi, welcome to DesignsByAlva. Thank you so much for supporting my endeavor to pursue my long-time passion of starting a business and creating fashions made with the needs of people with disabilities in mind.

I'm starting a fashion line consisting of designs inspired by my lived experience as a woman with a disability. My design philosophy is to create fashion pieces that adhere to society's current trends, while successfully incorporating the necessary functional elements needed by people with disabilities. Items include: modified jeans, business attire, water-proof gear with wheelchair attachments, and trench-coats.

I'm currently a 5th year at UC Berkeley working on my senior thesis which is exploring the inaccessibility of the fashion industry to people with disabilities, specifically women. As part of this project, I have gotten the opportunity to begin producing and manufacturing some of my accessible fashion designs. These designs are what I call ""functional fashion"" and keep in mind the accessibility needs of people with disabilities while adhering to existing fashion trends.

Our budget, $2,000, is based on making the prototypes and getting my business off the ground. Basically, what your money is going toward is the raw costs to start the business, including materials and labor, because I require physical assistance from other people to manufacture my designs. This also includes sewing, sketching, and shopping for supplies and materials.

If I do not reach the goal, I will use the money to start paying someone to make the designs, buy preliminary supplies, and try to make enough money to get the business started. And if I exceed the funding goal, I will put the money to use in furthering the marketing of my business and being able to produce more products at the outset.
-Volunteer to help to make a logo or help me with a webpage for my new business.
-Help manufacture and sew, or recommend someone who wants to work for me.
-Share this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook and Twitter.

LIVALL solely sponsored the Ning Xia Sports Lottery LIVALL Cycling Team, a UCI continental team registered in China, at the Tour of Qinghai Lake 2016.

Mountain Bike Helmet - MT1

Road Bike Helmet - BH81H

Heart Rate Monitor

 

The heart rate monitor tracks your heart rate throughout the entire ride, so you can monitor your training, push your performance, and get ready for the toughest of rides!

While cycling fast, your heartbeat can reach life-threatening levels. With the BH81H monitoring your heart rate, you'll know of any upcoming danger through automatic voice alerts.

By adopting the Pulse Transit Time (PTT) approach, the heart rate can be calculated through internal algorithm based on the luminance changes of blood flow in the forehead collected by a light sensor.

Turning Signal and Warning Lights

Turning at night can be dangerous as other drivers can't always see your gestures. With the BH81H smart helmet, you can control turning signals through the bling remote controller to ensure cycling safety.

Additionally, the high-visibility LED indicator lights will be your perfect bodyguard against overtaking traffic.

SOS Alert

Unfortunately, accidents are likely to occur. After a bad fall, it can be hard to seek medical help. Our helmet solves this problem. It detects when you fall, and automatically sends a message to a preset emergency contact person who can locate you via the message.

Walkie-Talkie

 Chatting with fellow riders is hard when you're cycling. The BH81H combined with the LIVALL Riding App provides riders an easy to use Walkie-Talkie when cycling.

Phone Calls

You won't miss any calls now. Answer and make calls by pressing the button in the middle of the remote controller.

Play Music

Listening to music with headphones or earbuds while cycling is dangerous
column2:
but, the BH81H relies on Bluetooth so you can hear both music and ambient noises around you for safe riding.

Snap Photos

The photo-taking button on the bling remote controller enables you to easily take photos with your phone and store them in the LIVALL Riding App. This is a far safer option that a handheld mobile phone to snap photo is dangerous for riding. Be a rider and a photographer all at once!

Bling remote controller can be attached to your handlebar. It allows you to easily control the LIVALL helmet and LIVALL Riding App, while remaining stable and focused. Control volume, skip tracks, pause music, make calls, snap photos and control the colored LED tail-lights to blink like the indicators. You can press the button 'left' or 'right'  to allow people behind you see where you are going.

1.Connect the Bling Remote

The connection will automatically be established when you turn on the helmet and bling remote, you can control the turn signal lights on the helmet via the bling remote.

2. Connect the Smartphone

If you want to play music, answer and make calls, you need to connect the smart helmet with a smartphone over Bluetooth 4.0.

3.Connect the LIVALL Riding App

If you want to activate functions like the heart rate monitor, Walkie-Talkie, photo button, and SOS alert, you need to connect the helmet with LIVALL Riding App.

The incredible BH81H is just a starter. We've also started crowdfunding for the MT1, a mountain-biking helmet, and the KS2, a helmet for kids.

Mountain Bike Helmet - MT1

This smart helmet is specially designed for mountain bikers. With Walkie-Talkie, music playing, turning signal, phone calls, and SOS alert features, the helmet is the perfect choice for enjoying every mountain challenge.

Kids Helmet - KS2

Protect your child with this stylish helmet. Tap lightly three times to turn on the top lights and tail lights, and twice to switch the color. Parents can easily locate their children.

Used cooperatively with LIVALL Riding App, BH81H (or MT1) and bling remote controller will offer riders a variety of functions.

LIVALL helmet can quick connect bling remote controller directly.

We use EPS foam and PC to make a one-piece helmet. Being puncture resistant and able to endure external impact at high speed, the helmet can scatter the force. With reasonable hole locations, the helmet is safe, well ventilated, comfortable and easy to wear. Between the inner side of the helmet and the head there is a ventilation channel, through which air can enter freely and therefore remove heat and achieve good ventilation. The helmet is also quite light.

Adjuster design

A high-end adjuster is configured inside the helmet to ensure the helmet is put on your head firmly. In this way, the helmet is safer and more stable. The helmet size can be adjusted.

LIVALL helmets conform to international standards, including impact tests.  

The shell of the LIVALL helmet comes in multiple colors so that your helmet can reflect your personality. We will contact our backers after the campaign to confirm what color LIVALL helmet you would like. If you don't specify your color, we will select the color for you.

 An adjuster inside each helmet allows you to fit the helmet snugly to the back of your head. We will contact our backers after the campaign. The LIVALL helmet will also have an adjuster to make sure your helmet fits properly.

Refer as many friends as you can and when their contributions total the amounts shown below, you'll be rewarded! For example, if your total referral contributions are $5,500, then you will receive a free LIVALL Mountain Bike Helmet! 

And YES, any previous LIVALL Smart Cycling Helmet referrals count toward this program as long as you used your unique referral link!

How Does it Works?

column1: • Log into your IndieGOGO account or click here to signup for an IndieGOGO account if you have not yet already created an account.

• Navigate to the LIVALL Smart Cycling Helmet campaign page and click the ""link"" icon on the right side of the campaign and then paste this link into an email to send to all your friends. Or click the Facebook, Twitter, Email or Embed icons to share your unique link on your social media accounts.
• View your total referral contribution amount by logging into your profile in the upper right and then click ""Referrals"".

Here is a screenshot showing how to share your unique URL (link):

Here are screenshots showing how to view your total referral contributions:

Delivery

Ship only certain countries. Shipping cost will be automatically calculated once you select a country. 

LIVALL designs and produces smart cycling devices. Our innovative design and high quality products have won multiple awards at IFA 2015 in Germany, and were finalists in the Last Gadget Standing contest at CES 2016 in Las Vegas.

LIVALL is committed to promoting and sponsoring cycling culture. We are the sponsor of Chinese pro-athlete Jin Feibao, and his team at events like the 5,800-km bike race across America, and the 15,000-kilometer race across the continent, arranged by Gou Huanqiang. The LIVALL Riding App is the only application officially designated by ACP-ROCN. LIVALL is also the principal sponsor of a UCI registered continental team for the 2016 and 2017 seasons.

We have successfully incorporated market feedback with two rounds of  product updates  the new LIVALL products are now the most advanced design ever. We've optimized the connection method and compatibility with smart phones, optimized the App by separating some functions to improve the experience for users, and optimized the design and product stability. And the IndieGOGO backers will be the first ones in the world who get to experience our new products, so we're launching crowdfunding here. With the aim to offer the best service and to build a global rider community, we've established subsidiaries in America, New Zealand, and Australia, as well as an office in Germany.

Other cool stuff that happened: LIVALL got N-TV press coverage in IFA 2016
We're delighted to see so many articles about LIVALL! That way, more people can have the chance to learn about LIVALL Smart Cycling Helmet.
iPhoneness: LIVALL Smart Cycling Helmet with HR, SOS, Walkie-Talkie
Upwire:  LIVALL Sets New Smart Helmet Standard for Cyclists
newson6:  LIVALL Introduces Latest Indiegogo Campaign, Launches Series of Smart Helmets
Cool Wearable: LIVALL BH81H Smart Cycling Helmet with HRM

Q: How do I use the helmet's functions?

A: To use functions like the heart rate monitor, SOS Alert, and data sharing, download the LIVALL Riding App.

Q: How do I get the LIVALL Riding App?

A: It's free in Apple's App Store and Google Play Store, or you can go to http://www.LIVALL.com/appdownload/ and follow the instructions to download it. You can log in with your Facebook account, or sign up for a LIVALL account using the App.

Q: How do I charge a LIVALL product?                                  

A: Connect a standard Micro USB at the back of the helmet below the indicator. 

Q: What material is the helmet made of?

A: This helmet is light, made from US-manufactured EPS foam which is bonded by PC to create a helmet which is durable and can resist high-speed impact by. The LIVALL helmet has been awarded many safety certifications such as BQB, CPSC (US), FCC ID (US), CE (EU), EN1078 (EU), AS/NZS2063 (AU), C-TICK (AU), ROHS. Thanks to the air circulation design inside the helmet, it also keeps you cool!  

Q: How long does the LIVALL battery last?

A: The batteries inside LIVALL Road Bike Helmet and Mountain Bike Helmet are built to last on average up to Max. 10hrs for lighting and 3-6hrs for music + lighting.

Q: I remember LIVALL launched a campaign on indieGOGO last year. So what is the difference between the previous campaign and this one now?

A: LIVALL did launch another campaign last year on IndieGOGO for a different model BH100 and accessories like charging phone holder and cadence sensor. This time we introduce our latest models BH81H(for road bike) with additional heart rate monitor, and MT1(for mountain bike) which is much lighter in weight(310g) than the former BH100. Besides, the connection between the helmet and other devices has been greatly simplified with much better user experience! 

Q: How can i choice the size and color?

A: We'll send you an email for final confirmation of your helmet size and color choices before shipment.
